title: Extremely poor condition. Please read complete review
text:
The location of this hotel is excellent, but the maintenance and hygiene standards are extremely poor. I’ve been staying here for the past 10 years, but in the last 2 years, the quality has declined drastically. 
Don't rely on reviews older than two years, as the condition was much better back then. However, the management now seems to have completely left the hotel in the hands of the staff, and as you can imagine, how they will take care without any supervision. 
We stayed in the soo called most premium AC rooms of the hotel. they reuse dustbin bags from previous stays, which still have stains of tobacco and ketchup. The towels were dirtyyy, and the bed sheets appeared to have not been changed since the last 2-3 guests. The sofa and chairs were also in poor condition. There was noticeable seepage on the walls throughout the room, and a foul odor lingered in the air.

We had booked the room for two days, but the conditions were so bad that we considered switching hotels the following day (although we couldn't, every hotel was full because of new year). Despite the hotel being nearly empty, both the room service and cleanliness were abysmal, and the overall service was disappointing.
placeInfo/address: The Mall Rd Opp Ropeways, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Dirtiest, poorest hotel
text: Very very dirty and poor hotel. I don't want to give one star only because of food. Curtains was dirty , almiras , bed linen , pillow covers, rooms are smelly, no dressing table only one mirror without lighting. No amenities which are shown on mmt
placeInfo/address: The Mall Rd Opp Ropeways, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Excellent hotel in mall road
text:
Hotel is located at mall road near roap way.
I stayed in this hotel in Jan 2024 with my family , Very good experience about Hotel location , scenic view from balcony , rooms , staff services & food .

However I want to share an incident that happened to me in that hotel.
My daughter's health suddenly worsened at night around 4 am , I connected to the reception , One staff Manish was there , He immediately called his other staff Pooran , 
Even though so cold in the morning at around 5 am  , Pooran took me to the doctor on two wheeler for my daughter . 
Really I salute to Pooran from my heart who helped me so much that night  , may god give him much progress in life.

However All other staffs were also very polite, well-behaved & knows how to handle their customer

Overall I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for great place to stay in Mussoorie.
placeInfo/address: The Mall Rd Opp Ropeways, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: location  is an advantage
text:

title: WORST HOTEL
text:
"NEVER GO FOR THIS PROPERTY "
Hotel rooms just look good in pictures , the bedsheets have leftover hairs on them and no cleaning done even after 2-3 requests.

The worst experience ever had in any hotel visited.

title: Good hotel, excellent location.... but POOR service
text:
Hotel is good. Location is excellent. But service is below par. As I write, I'm still at #103 . I would point few things out.

1) The room is just beside the entrance stair. Hence, you cannot remove the curtains because of your privacy

2) Right after check-in I informed the Front Desk that the intercom in my room was not working. Not for once in last 2 days, anyone bothered to come & check. 

3) You provide tea/ coffee amenities in room which is excellent. But again no suger / suger fee sachets were provided. I had to tell Front Desk yesterday. After that only I got some. 

Being a hotelier myself, these 3 basic errors are not acceptable to me. I've got a feeling that I faced these issues since my reservation was from an online portal ( lesser tariff than the Hotel Tariff quoted to me by mail)

I'll perhaps book another hotel next time I visit Mussoorie
placeInfo/address: The Mall Rd Opp Ropeways, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Excellent Location and View but needs a lot of Improvement
text:
Location of the hotel is excellent, so is the view from all the valley facing rooms. 
However there is a huge discrepancy in rates,  which is against the Hospitality norms. When enquired on the phone, we were offered a much higher rates' however on a walk in entry, we got a much lower rate. 
The staff is not bothered, they just seemed to be doing their job and getting their salary. No one will wish you or acknowledge you. No one informed us about the check out timings, and some unprofessional lady at the reception started calling us from 10 am in the morning stating ' can we send someone for the luggage' . We understand that all hotels have a check out time, but unless informed to a guest prior, the hotel management cannot force it upon them. The luggage boys literally barged into our room and grabbed on to our half packed bags and carried them out. In order to chuck us out. The gentleman at the reception made us fill and sign the Rech Card on arrival and next day early morning came running to our room to get some register signed saying 'our boss is here and he is scolding us' Highly Unprofessional!!
The luggage boys / service boys are super greedy, they would stare at your hands for Tip... 
I am amazed even after at all the negative reviews in the past by several other guests, the owner and the management doesnt seem to do anything about it.

The hotel has good scope if the owner looks into his business seriously and gets better trained staff. 

The only good part of our stay was the view from our balcony.  The check out experience spoilt our stay- Constant rude calls from the unprofessional lady and the greedy luggage boys.
placeInfo/address: The Mall Rd Opp Ropeways, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Worst Place in Mussoorie
text:
This hotel is the worst place to go in Mussoorie. Not at all recommended. The owner is probably the rudest person you will ever meet. They do not stay true to their commitments.

Below are the main issues:

1. Rooms have a water problem wherein they are constantly damp.
2. The hotel owner is an unpleasant man who is a thief and will overcharge you at any given opportunity.
3. The rooms have holes in their doors wherein sometimes monkeys can even enter your room.
4. The washrooms are damp and have very loud exhausts which you will be able to hear in the room as well.
5. The beds have no lumbar support whatsoever and will give you back problems within a day.

All in all, a place to be avoided at all costs. Don’t waste your money at this sorry excuse for a hotel.
placeInfo/address: The Mall Rd Opp Ropeways, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Not recommended for Kids & Elderly people
text:
The hotel has good infrastructure and ambiance but maintenance is very poor, may be they are short of manpower. Secondly, It is located on the mall road but at a very good height which has around 40-45 stairs to climb and at a steep height.

**Service** - The hotel service is very poor, they don't even provide the basic amenities like hand towel, toilet paper roll, bathroom slippers and very slow in responding to your queries. One has to request then only they will provide all the things.

**Accommodation** - Not very good, though it is very hyped for their location and view but their balcony is too small and you can get the same location view from many points on mall road.

**Food** - They do not have a restaurant but they provide in room service and the food is good in taste as well.

**Location** - Easy to reach as it's on main mall road only, but like I said they are at very good height and if you are travelling with family by your own car, you are not allowed to enter on mall road after 4.30 PM. And the worst part is the hotel doesn't provide any shuttle service and from mall road entrance to Hotel it is about 2 Km which you have to walk, because even rickshaws are not allowed in that distance. And if you reach before 4.30 PM then be ready to climb 40-45 stairs and some walk on height as well.

Overall, I would not recommend this Hotel unless they improve their services like PROVIDING SHUTTLE service, fasten their in room service. respond quickly to your services and most importantly provide basic amenities.

 Thank you for your rating and your review.   

We regret the inconvenience caused.  

General Manager  
Hotel Mall Palace

title: Disappointing
text: They have cheated showing good pictures of the hotel on the MMT but provided room in the adjacent old small building. The main building had ~ 5 floors & looks better from outside and the old one had 3 floors. Although it was off season & I booked Executive balcony room, but they refuse to provide  room in the main building and on higher floor, in spite of several requests. The Hotel is almost mid of library chowk (~ 1Km.) and Picture palace (~0.7 Km.) thus if one came by taxi or hired vehicle then option to reach the hotel by walk from the library chowk/ Picture palace or by rikshaw from Librery chowk till Jhula ghar (~ 50 m from the hotel). Private vehicle can enter the mall road paying toll. Hotel is about 30 steps up from the road climb through narrow stairs. Outside view was not very clear due to dense fog/ cloud during my 2 days stay in Mall Palace. Service was good and they tried to solve the problem. Food (Room service only) taste was not good & expensive. Payment only by cash. There are many better food options available @ library chowk and towards Picture palace. Although it was a good stay but disappointed due to their deception.

title: Warm hospitality, amazing staff and food—but poor experience with manager
text:
We had a mostly wonderful stay here, but unfortunately one issue with the manager left a sour taste.

The property itself is charming, the food was fresh and delicious, and the staff went above and beyond—especially in caring for my elderly grandmother, who stayed in the room alone. Their kindness and attentiveness were deeply appreciated. The owner was also incredibly helpful and accommodating—he allowed us to secure our reservation with a 25% down payment due to our concerns about sending large amounts via UPI without a proper booking guarantee. That gave us peace of mind.

Now the downside: the manager, Anish, was extremely rude from the start. He refused to provide a proper bill initially and insisted UPI was the only payment option. We were a group of four at first, and had booked accordingly. When a fifth member decided to join, they booked a separate room themselves. At that point, we should’ve only been charged for one extra person, but Anish charged me ₹1,000 extra for their room, even though we had made it explicitly clear that we wanted our payments and bills kept separate. We didn’t realize the mistake until after handing over cash—at which point they refused to refund me and instead asked us to collect the amount from the other party member. Anish was dismissive and unpleasant throughout the interaction.

Rooms were a bit below our expectations in terms of cleanliness, but the staff cleaned promptly and brought us fresh towels. A dehumidifier would have helped, as the room felt damp. Also, two electrical outlets burned out when using the heater provided, which made us hesitant to use it much after that.

We would absolutely consider coming back—the setting, food, and staff made it a memorable stay—but only if we didn’t have to deal with the same manager again.
placeInfo/address: Hathipaon Near George Everest Point Road, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: A Quaint Stay With The Much Needed Respite From the Main Town
text:
The property that provides a homely ambiance along with good food, clean rooms, hot water and a breathtaking view of the mountains where, on a clear day you will be able to see the Himalayas!! What hasn't been mentioned anywhere is the stellar view of the night sky one can enjoy from a small deck they have on the 1st floor. You can even count the stars on a clear night!!! And I am sure to share some of the picturesque snaps that I took of the place. George Everest house is a two km hike from Seegreen and you even get to head to on of the most haunted places in Asia - Lambi Dehar Mines where 50,000 labourers had died a painful death and you can still hear their screams in the night! If you are into birding, Benof Bird Santuary is around five km from the property. You can hire a bike for INR 800 and head there.

P.S. - The Seegreen Cafe serves the best pizza in the whole of Mussoorie! And I drolled over their pakoras and chilly cheese toast too. But do bear in mind, this is a slow cafe. So sit back, relax and enjoy the ambiance while you wait for the delectable eatables.
placeInfo/address: Hathipaon Near George Everest Point Road, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Review on see green lodge hathi paon Mussourie
text: I stayed at the see green lodge in 17 and 18 Aug 22. The lodge is over rated. Location of the lodge is on a tri junction which is noisy and dirty due to plastic waste. It gives no scenic view what so ever. Free parking implies parking on the road side. Rooms are dingy, dirty with a peculiar stench. The linen provided is pathetic. The towels are displayed are way to old and can't be used. The property didn't have a generator power back up hence you can not have hot water. The staff is staying next to the the guest rooms making noise, using facilities meant for the guests and appalling to see the staff eating meals in the main cafe, brushing their teeth and watching videos in the presence of the guests. They are least helpful in terms of any assistance or Local information. The cafe and the rooms are full of flies and insects. title: One of Mussoorie's best places to stay
text: After being on the road for nearly 3 months in North east India, we were looking for a quiet, peaceful and beautiful place to unwind for a couple of days before we began our journey to Ladakh. Seegreen Lodges was just what we needed. The place is surrounded by trees and mountains on all sides and one can see and hear birds and other animals going about their day, oblivious to our presence. The room was clean and comfortable with a spectacular view. The best part was talking to Sanjeev over delicious cuisine in the cafe downstairs. The variety of cuisine is vast and ranges from chocolate chip cookies to Mussoorie delicacies. There are amazing places to check out nearby. We liked that the place is close enough to the town but is not in the crowded part of Mussoorie so one can hear birds chirping over cars honking :) We did have a little confusion with the location on Google maps so I would highly recommend calling ahead and ensuring the route you plan on taking is accurate. Sanjeev is very helpful and will provide quick and clear instructions. The staff is friendly and helpful. Seegreen has been added to our list of favourite places to visit and we can't wait to visit again. Thank you, Sanjeev and team for the amazing stay.

title: Beautiful location ,cozy rooms ,amazing food and hospitality.
text:
We stayed at Seegreen lodges from 28 th of March until 30 of March. We were in a group of 6 adults and 2 kids. 
The place has a very positive energy and gorgeous views.
We had booked three rooms and one log hut. The rooms were clean and cozy   And the log hut was like a small Swiss chalet complete with an attic . The log hut had the most amazing views of the mountains. The log hut can accommodate a family of 4 easily. 
Seegreen lodges has a namesake cake which serves the best pizzas in Mussoorie.
The first night we stayed there Vicky and Amisha ( the owners ) had arranged for a barbecue . The food was ( both veg and non veg) delicious.
The paranthas that they serve for breakfast are something I would really go back for . The Rhododendron sharbat and the chutney they served was a very personal touch and was out of this world . 
All in all I would definitely want to visit this place again in winter as the pictures we saw were surreal.
Hoping to go back this winter .

title: Even better than our last visit
text:
We reviewed this place in 2016 after staying there in winter 15. The place is largely unchanged but maintained well. Clean and spare. Excellent and knowledgable staff who absolutely do not hover but available when needed. The pahadi dinners we had were excellent as was the pahadi tea.  Breakfast was included and substantial. In fact all food portions are quite big.

Walls are paper thin so plan to speak softly, which anyway is a good idea. 

Weekdays are quiet and uncrowded. I reccommend visiting on weekdays to avoid the weekend crowd downstairs in the cafe. Alternately do like we did and just leave on a day long trek to get away from the crowd. The restaurant downstairs may not be safest place in covid times, however cold and sunny outdoor seating is available.

title: A lovely short stay on the lap of mountains
text: Vicky's Seegreen Cafe Lodge  was a nice experience for us. The room was cosy with clean bed and a clean ensuite bathroom. The little surprise was a sneak peek of the snow clad Himalayas. Basking in the morning sun on the deck in front of the room with their signature Ginger Lemon Honey tea was an absolute delight. Also do try the heavenly chocolate waffle and other dishes at the cafe below the rooms. The staff were friendly and always ready to help the guests with a smile on their face.  Vickey himslef enquired us about our experience and did meet us also as he was present there during our stay. I highly recommend the place for a vacation stay.

title: 100% visit
text:
This beautiful place is perfectly located far enough from the main town so that you get peace & quiet and just close enough so that you can easily walk / bike / drive to Mussoorie which is 3-4km away.
Seegreen is an ideal spot to make your base whether you want to spend time outdoors / just laze all day / access Mussoorie & Landour. There are several walks / hikes which literally begin from the moment you step out of the cafe -- highly recommend Benong Bird Sanctuary -- it's about 10k there & back -- very pretty, did it alone and was super happy to not see any people through the entire hike.
The log hut is extremely peaceful, charming with brick & wood interiors, away from the main cafe & well secluded if you are looking for your own space through your stay. Tama, their pahaadi dog is a top companion who you might just find lazing around the deck with you and making cute faces, asking for belly rubs.
Cafe food is great -- we thoroughly enjoyed the Indian food, but really, everything we ordered was on point. Must mention - loved to be greeted with big smiles and ready to do attitudes from the staff -- Suvinder, Gudvir & Biraj who all made sure we were comfortable.
Wifi works like a dream. Must visit in my opinion -- we were there 10 days and couldn't get enough.

title: Excellent experience!
text:
We had a phenomenal stay at the Lodges. Excellent aesthetics, Uber hygienic, very well maintained and managed, superb food. 

The outdoor deck with a bench is so amazing - sit, soak in the aroma of the fresh air, play your music, make your cocktails and enjoy the mesmerising view of the Himalayas. In fact the first thing you see when you wake up through the front window screen is the mountains nestled in a picturesque setting. Couldn’t get better. 

What we loved the most, above all these things, is the company of two guests that come as a pact with this stay- the two cuddly munchkins- their domesticated dogs - Bhalu and Tamba- they played with us, slept in our cottage, trekked with us, and guarded us- we certainly are going back to meet these friends of ours soon, and immerse in the same wonderful experience we indulged in back when we were there

title: Loved the stay!
text:
I visited this hotel from 11 Dec to 14 Dec 2018 with family. It’s a nice hotel with a very good view from the balcony along with the friendly staff. It is located opposite to the Gun hill ropeway and 15 mins walk from the library chowk. They have small parking which can accommodate 5-6 cars though the parking is a bit tricky. 

We went for executive balcony room from where you can see lush green valleys. The room was neat along with the bad linings and pillow. The washroom was clean though the bowl is located between washbasin and a bathroom glass which makes it slightly difficult to accommodate an average size Indian.

People managing the kitchen deserve an appreciation as they were helpful enough to customize their food for my little daughter. Room service was quick and very responsive.

Overall a nice hotel which is worth a visit. Keep up the good work!

title: Great find near Mussoorie
text:
We had an absolutely wonderful stay at Jharipani Castle! The rooms are beautifully designed with a perfect blend of rustic charm and modern luxury, from the stone walls and wooden beams to the plush teal furnishings, everything feels warm, cozy, and elegant. The large glass windows bring in stunning views of the mountains and clouds, making it feel like living in the middle of nature without compromising on comfort. The property has a historic heritage as well.
The highlight for us was definitely the breathtaking view from the balcony and outdoor seating areas. Watching the sunrise and sunset over the misty hills was truly magical, something we will never forget. The property is designed to make you pause, relax, and soak in the beauty all around.
Every corner of the resort reflects attention to detail, whether it’s the comfortable bedding, the spacious layout, or the inviting outdoor spots to sit and enjoy a cup of tea with a view.
If you’re looking for a peaceful getaway in the hills with luxury, comfort, and spectacular views, this place is an absolute gem. Can’t wait to come back!

Property manager Mr Nitin is a really generous person who helped us in resolving our queries regarding the resort, or Mussoorie in general. I found the hospitality to be top notch and that is what will drive me again to visit this place. Thank you Seclude, Mussoorie!!
ownerResponse/text:

Thank you for sharing your experience! It’s wonderful to hear that Mukesh and Mr. Nitin made your stay so enjoyable and that our hospitality left a lasting impression. We’re glad you’re already considering a return visit. We look forward to welcoming you back to Seclude Mussoorie!
placeInfo/address: Picture Palace Road Westonal Cottage, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Beautiful stay

title: Expected a tasteful property and friendly staff. But not so. much more.
text:
IT WAS OUR FIRST TIME WITH SECLUDE AND WE WERE NOT SATISFIED with the property on many fronts. First the room is not upto the mark if u compare the amount we are spending. And specially you should not sell it as 3 sharing. I haven't paid good amount to sleep on a cot in the coridor. 
  Cleanliness is not upto the mark. There was one area in the room behind glass door, although not useable but still has to be clean bc it is part of room. 
      AND MOST IMPORTANTLY ATTITUDE OF STAFF. SPECIALLY THE MANAGER WAS NOT AT ALL FRIENDLY. HIS BODY LANGUAGE IS LIKE PLS DONT MAKE ANY REQUEST WE WILL PROVIDE AS PER OUR LIKING. 
      AND FINALLY WE HAVE TO PAY RS. 500 PER DAY FOR THE PARKING🥵.  WE WERE INTIMATED ROAD SIDE PARKING IS AVAILABLE BUT ON REACHING THERE WE WERE ASKED TO PAY FOR PARKING IN ADVANCE. 
      SO OVERALL PROPERTY DIDNT ADD ANY VALUE TO OUR STAY.
ownerResponse/text: We're truly sorry to hear that your experience did not meet your expectations. Regarding the parking, it was mentioned in the reservation voucher that parking would be either street parking or paid parking. We have also noted your concerns about the staff behavior and have informed the manager. Please be assured that we are taking this seriously and will address the issue. However, none of these concerns were communicated to the manager during your stay, and we would have been happy to assist had we known. Your feedback is important to us, and we will work on improving the experience.
placeInfo/address: Picture Palace Road Westonal Cottage, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: A beautiful and peaceful getaway
text:
Beautiful property, beautiful location. They have the cutest, most varied ambient rooms for you to choose from according to your mood. If you're someone who appreciates effortless design and aesthetics, this place is a treat to be at. The common areas cover almost all kinds of sitting for you to comfortably lounge in. 

And, most importantly, the staff is very warm and welcoming. They'll leave no stone unturned to make you feel like your most comfortable self. The food's pretty good as well - I tried dal, rice, rotis, aloo jeera (more like sindhi crispy aloo tuk) and shahi paneer, and they were all delicious.

If you're looking for a quiet getaway place surrounded by scenic beauty and nature, this is the place to be. Visit with friends, family, partner or solo - I feel this place has a different experience to offer with different people.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Rishika,
Thank you for your lovely review! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the beautiful property, varied ambient rooms, and comfortable common areas. title: Excellent service makes the difference
text:
We were 7 people & booked 3 balcony rooms in 5th floor via MMT. The hotel is on Mall Road - just opposite to GunHill ropeway starting point. 

Pros:
1. Neat & clean & spacious rooms & bathrooms with necessary modern amenities
2. 24 hours hot water available
3. Lift available
4. Excellent service - whatever you need, you will get it in 5 min. If they need more time (like for dinner to serve), they will clearly communicate that. 
5. All staffs are very polite, well-behaved & knows how to handle their customer
6. Parking facility is available. We checked out at around 10:15 and they allow us to keep our car at their parking place till 1.
7. Their is an amazing view of Doon valley from the balcony.
8. Foods are tasty

Cons:
1. Foods are tasty, but very expensive. 

Note:
1. Cars are not allowed in Mall road between 4 pm & 10 pm. So if you are coming Mussorie by car, please keep it in mind.
2. The hotel is around 1 km from Gandhi Chowk & rickshaw fare is 50/-

Overall highly recommended...
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr Sett,  
Greetings from Hotel Mall Palace!  
Thank you for your stay with us.  
Thank you for a five star rating and a wonderful review. 
It was our pleasure to host you with us.  
We would love to host you again soon!  
Thank You.   
Guest Relations Manager  
Hotel Mall Palace

title: Nice room, amazing view from balcony.
text: Apart from the gloomy staircase and corridors and some weirdly designed entrance, this hotel is a nice pick in mall road . I did the mistake of going to Mussoorie without booking a hotel  but I got lucky and I got their last room at 8 Pm for a fair price. I liked the room, it was big and clean, their bathroom had a shower cubicle which I appreciated so much because after a hectic driving , it was great enjoying a hot shower.  The room also had a balcony through which you can see the valley ; at night and early morning it is a real treat. The only problem is that there is no WI-FI in the rooms, you should go sit at their reception to use it which is frankly ridiculous. I would stay there again and I would recommend it to a friend but I hope they fix the WIFI problem.
ownerResponse/text:

Hence, if you are coming by some public vehicle, its better to hire a rickshaw from library for the hotel. The hotel food was good and staff was very hospitable. The room balcony serves as a perfect place to chill out during the evening or night time.

title: Great comfort
text:
I recently spent a week at Jharipani Castle with my elderly parents, and it was a truly memorable experience. The peaceful setting, heritage charm, and stunning views made it an ideal place to unwind and reconnect.

What stood out most, however, was the exceptional hospitality. The entire staff was courteous, attentive, and always willing to help — ensuring that my parents felt comfortable and well taken care of throughout our stay.

A special mention to Hasan ji at the front desk and Sanjay ji for their warmth which made a big difference to our experience. Whether it was arranging transport, guiding us on nearby spots, or simply checking in on our comfort, they were always present with a smile.

Highly recommend Jharipani Castle for anyone looking for a serene, heartfelt getaway — especially with family. Thank you to the team for making our stay so special.

text:

ownerResponse/text:
We take all feedback seriously and are committed to maintaining a safe, respectable, and welcoming environment for all our guests. However, the claims made in your review are entirely false and defamatory.

Our property operates under strict policies and in full compliance with local laws and hospitality regulations. We maintain 24/7 security, surveillance systems, and a trained professional staff to ensure the safety and comfort of every guest. Allegations such as the promotion of illegal activities, including prostitution and drug use, are completely unfounded and damaging.

We have no record of any complaint or report matching your description during your alleged stay. If you were truly a guest at our property, we encourage you to contact us directly with your reservation details so that we can investigate any legitimate concerns. However, if this review is an attempt to tarnish our reputation without basis, please be aware that we reserve the right to take legal action against slanderous and malicious content intended to harm our business.

We stand by our integrity, our staff, and the experience we offer. For authentic reviews and real guest feedback, we invite prospective guests to explore trusted platforms or reach out to us directly with any questions or concerns.

Sincerely,
Mehmood Hasan (Manager)

title: Home amidst a fairyland
text:
This was my second visit to Seegreen lodges. I was here back in January in 2019 and since then I’ve just longed to be back. Hathipaon is a few kilometers off Mall Road and is perfect for a short cozy stay amidst the mountains. Seegreen lodges is a home away from home, the staff is warm and very welcoming and make sure that the guests have a comfortable and an amazing time. 
Somendar, Gudvir and Viraj will go to any extents to make sure that the trip is a success and are well informed about the surroundings. A big thank you to them and hats off to all their efforts to make me feel so comfortable and will urge you to go out into the wilderness and look around and be closer to nature.
Last but not the least the main and the cutest residents of the lodge are Tama and Bhaloo who will steal your hearts in one look. 
Here you can have your delicious meals cooked by Gudvirji, out by the deck surrounded by the calls of various birds that is so damn enchanting.
I already can’t wait to be back here and spend some more time here in this wonderland called Hathipaon.
ownerResponse/text: Thank you Pranay for the lovely review!

text:

title: The best start to 2021
text:
Seegreeen is honestly the best place we could have hoped for our trip. 
Firstly it's located at Hathipaon,which is a little distance from Mussoorie and is thus the best place to experience calmness and serenity. At the same time it's hardy 10 mins (by car) or 50 mins (by walk) from Library Chowk, and thus the typical Mussoorie places are at an arm's distance. 
Second of all the rooms are very warm and home like. They are spacious enough to have a comfortable stay for 2-3 people. The beds are cosy, the rooms are aesthetically pleasing and the bathroom is neat. 

Thirdly the cafe downstairs serves some amazing food. Although their pasta, pizza, and hot chocolate is something everyone needs to go for, their basic food (dal, chawal, roti, sabzi) is also very delicious for people who wish to eat basic Indian food. 

Lastly the staff and the owner are very warm and welcoming people. They make sure you feel at home and have an amazing stay. 

So if you're planning to go to Mussoorie, close you eyes and book a room here (only if you're lucky enough that it's available)
ownerResponse/text: Thank you for the detailed review. We look forward to yoir next stay with us!

title: Difficult to sleep due to to plywood walls
text:
If you value your undisturbed sleep, then do not stay at the Sea Green lodge in Hathi Paon Mussoorie.

The walls between the rooms are made of plywood and so you can be constantly disturbed by sounds from those in the room next to you.

In our case, on day one night, the couple in the next room had a long periodic argument that lasted most of the night. We were finally able to get some peace and quiet only at 4 AM.

The next night, the new guests checked in around 13.0AM. For almost the next one hour, their creaking door kept opening and shutting.  Again we were able to fall asleep only around 3 AM. And at 6AM they started playing music. And so goodbye sleep….

But to be balanced, the food is very tasty, and the staff are helpful. By all means, use the Sea Green café during the day, but think twice before spending the night.  

One of the reasons we selected the Sea Green Lodge was to chill in the day in what seemed to be per their website their large luxurious lawns. But once we had checked in, we discovered there are no lawns at that we could go sit on – only some meadows around 10-15 minutes walk away. This came as quote a shock. 

In terms of the ambience, the Sea Green Lodge is comfortable, but not terribly well maintained. The place seems not to have been repainted for quite some time. The rules also reasonably customer unfriendly. For example, this is the first hotel I have stayed in my life where the hotel staff refuse to give you the Wi-Fi password but insist that you bring them your device for face-to-face interaction - even in these COVID-19 days of social distancing.  And quite a few times, the staffs did not wear masks.

Do stay at the Sea Green Lodge Hathipaon Mussoorie at your own risk.
placeInfo/address: Hathipaon Near George Everest Point Road, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Up above the world so high! Beauty, tranquility and comfort!
text: It’s been over a month since we stayed for a week at the Seegreen Wooden Cabin and we can still feel the afterglow of visiting this hidden away gem in Mussoorie. Never has a hotel or bnb or home stay has touched our lives in such a manner - it’s completely etched in our memories forever and even our lifestyle habits! We ate the best food made by the Seegreen Cafe team with Ustad at the helm, Kamlaji and the super friendly and helpful caretaker Sovendarji; we slept like babies in the cosy log cabin and we even got the necessary workout from climbing to and from the cabin. The views upon waking were breathtaking and we still can’t stop thinking about the sunsets! The amazing masala chai and ginger-lemon-honey tea were always available to us and we sure had our unlimited share. The tariff and pricing at the cafe are so affordable that we even thought about staying longer. We’d go back to Seegreen in a heartbeat! It’s changed us in so many ways, we wake up earlier, feel refreshed and we will forever be grateful to the owners Sanjeev and his wife (who were staying just next to us at their holiday home) for creating this marvellous hideaway. Thank you so much for your generous hospitality, we absolutely can’t recommend Seegreen enough!
ownerResponse/text:
Thank you so much for your kind and encouraging works . Getting the place up and running after the lull due to lockdown was taking effort , especially the ensuring the safety factor 
Reviews like yours , mean so much to us ! 
We truly enjoyed hosting you both and looking forward to seeing you again 
This time for a cup of coffee in our verandha 
Thank you guys ☺️

title: Beautiful Log Hut!!
text: Serene and beautiful are the words that come to mind when you think back to the time you spent in the Loghut. The Loghut sits perched on the most picturesque location overlooking the forest below. There weather added to the bliss with the clouds flowing in through windows. We had a great stay at the Loghut doing really nothing but having the most awesome time staring out of the window. A great place to relax and unwind and be a part of nature. A special mention about the hand tossed Pizzas served fresh in the cafe. Special shoutout to the host for getting the stay arranged at such a short notice.
ownerResponse/text:
Mickey 
This is the best weather to see the clouds ☁️ float in our midst ! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay 
We have just opened up and it’s refreshing to get positive feedback in these difficult times 
Th ka you for ur kind words
placeInfo/address: Hathipaon Near George Everest Point Road, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Serene experience
text: We had a very peaceful stay amidst pine trees in the log hut. Peaceful atmosphere and relaxing stay. Loved playing with tama and Mowgli.. Yummy freshly cooked meals.. Enjoyed the trek to george everest peak..must go place for a Mussoorie trip.. will definitely recommend staying here rather than the busy touristy places
ownerResponse/text:

title: Memorable Stay
text:
I visited SeeGreen Lodges recently and undoubtedly it is the best place to be, if you want to blend with nature! It is just 10 minutes from the MallRoad. The place is surrounded by mountains which makes it even more apt.
Rooms are simple with basic amenities and are perfect for a cozy stay.
I should not forget to appreciate the wonderful and generous staff with all the needed information. The food was was amazingly delicious - be it Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner or Snacks :)
That apart, the hike to George Everest Point in rains with my friends will always stay fresh in our minds. Highly recommended!
ownerResponse/text:
ahh ! The rains in the mountains 
Now we are waiting eagerly for the month of July 
Indeed the rains are beautiful , with the clouds ⛅️ playing hide and seek with us at the cafe !
I’m happy that you enjoyed your stay and we are so happy that you appreciate our staff with such encouraging words 
Thank you 😊 
Have a good day today 
Stay safe
placeInfo/address: Hathipaon Near George Everest Point Road, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Exemplary Experience
text: Visited Seagreen Lodges with family in the month of December. It was indeed a mesmerizing experience. Was amazed by the warm hospitality of of the care taker Somender Ji. Surely will visit again if possible.

title: Awesome hotel and view
text:
Room No : 504 (with attached balcony)
Hotel staff was polite.
Room was awesome and cosy. The view from balcony of the city is just out of the world. 
No complimentary breakfast included. Not tried the food.
Room doesnot have geyser but hot water is 24*7 available. Room had the following things..refrigerator, hot water kettle, tea and coffee making items. 
TV was present with basic channels.
Towels and soap were kept in room. Bed linens were very neat and clean. Additional blanket was kept in the cupboard.
Location of the hotel is good. Hotel is on maid road, and is just 1km from Main mall market. Food is easily available in the market.
Car parking space is available.

Only bad thing is the sitting space for Commod in bathroom.

title: Awesome view Paisa Vasool Property
text:
Stayed there for 3 nights during an off peak season in November. Stayed in Executive Suit with Independent Balcony on 5th Floor. Rooms have been renovated and have a chick style. View from the balcony is awesome and its just next to Ropeway . Paisa vasool due to the rates they offered in off peak season otherwise all hotels are overpriced. They do not have complimentary breakfast option and dinner was ok. Service was good and staff was courteous. The main attraction:-
1) Just mid way on Mall road.You can go to library chowk or Mall road from here. 
2)Everything is around this hotel.
3)Lots of eating options near by.Sagar Ratna, Dominos, chats etc.
4)Parking is available,
5)Room have 24 hrs hot water.
Overall, nice stay in Mussoorie . It was my second stay though. Last time i stayed near Library Chowk and screwd my holidays .

text:

Rooms - Rooms were quite spacious with beautiful balcony offering doon valley view. Mattress was better this time. 

Bathroom- Bathrooms are now big and clean. 

Food - Earlier food here not used to be good but now they have improved a lot. Food was yummy. 

Parking - Parking facility is limited considering its a hill area.

Staff - Staff was polite. 

They have almost tripled their tariff rates but then it is worth it now.

title: Good budget hotel on Mall Road
text: We stayed there for 2 nights in Oct 2017 with my family. It is a good hotel in mid range budget. Rooms with private balconies are good enough with nice view of the dehradhun valley. I booked the rooms for around 1100/- INR per night. Which is quite cheap. There are some areas where modification needed as this is a old hotel, but rooms are clean with all the modern facilities. The best part of this hotel is the location. It's on the mall road. But if you are having more luggage, it's difficult to enter the hotel as it is bit higher than the road. In that case you can call the reception person and ask for some one to carry your luggage. Fooding is available at the hotel, but they don't have much varieties, and the restaurant use to close down earlier at night by 8:00 pm in the evening. I will recommend this hotel for solo family travelers who need a perfect location within the budget.

title: Great place!
text:
Our 2 day stay in this hotel was very comfortable. Even in May, Mussoorie remains pleasantly cool. Ours wasn't an AC room, and honestly just a fan was sufficient for us. It turns cold in the evening. The bathrooms have 24-hour hot water supply. The rooms are very clean, spacious and well maintained. The beds have comforters to keep you warm and snug. We didn't eat at their restaurant since we wanted to explore the restaurants in the vicinity (and there are many!)
Once you get to Gandhi Chowk, you will have to take a hand pulled rickshaw which will take you (and your luggage) to the hotel. Vehicles aren't allowed past Gandhi Chowk. The hotel has a flight of stairs to the reception. You might want to hire help to take your luggage up the stairs. I think they have a lift, but it was under renovation at the time of our visit. Their staff is very helpful. You will have to call Housekeeping to clean your room, otherwise they won't come on their own (which is fine). Overall a pleasant stay!

title: Nature , Nostalgia , and Sernity
text: Staying at Hotel Jharipani Castle felt like stepping into the past. The property has vintage charm, with great views of the hills and valleys. Rooms are simple but clean and spacious. The staff is polite, and the food is fresh and made to order. Evenings by the bonfire and stargazing were unforgettable. It’s a peaceful, offbeat spot perfect for those who want to disconnect from the city and enjoy nature. Not for luxury seekers, but for those who appreciate heritage and quiet, it’s a great choice.

title: Clam retreat with heritage vibes
text: Hotel Jharipani Castle is a peaceful heritage property just outside the busy parts of Mussoorie. The place offers beautiful views of the valley and a calm atmosphere perfect for a relaxing getaway. Rooms are clean and cozy, and the colonial-style decor adds charm. The staff is friendly, and the food feels homemade and comforting. Sitting on the terrace at sunset was a highlight. It's a great spot for nature lovers, writers, or couples seeking quiet time. If you enjoy history and scenic beauty over luxury, this place is ideal.

title: Top-notch experience at Seclude
text:
Seclude Mussoorie has my heart.❤️ 
This is a very picturesque place to stay at. The hospitality of the staff here is top notch. The facilities are great and the two best things about Seclude are the scenic views and the very delicious food. The chef here is a star. The food is very fresh, homely and the yummiest. 😋
The concept of rooms at Seclude is also very interesting. The common place is very pretty. Mr. Illu and Mr. Arvind are very helpful and polite. Mr. Nitin was very helpful throughout and he made sure that our trip was smooth and comforting.😊 This is also very close to Mall Road which makes it even more likeable. The proximity to Mall Road is in a way that the place is secluded from the hustle of the crowd but also not so secluded from the mall road making it a perfect place to stay at. 
I’d highly recommend this place to everyone and make sure that you try the food of this place. Trust me, you will not go back disappointed. 🤩

title: Terrible Property and Terrible Manager
text:
During my recent hotel stay, I had a highly disappointing experience with numerous issues that significantly affected my stay in Seclude Mussorie Firstly, there was a complete lack of maintenance in the rooms, resulting in smelly and poorly maintained spaces. The washrooms had low water pressure, which made it inconvenient to use. Unfortunately, the manager (Nitin )seemed unconcerned about these issues and provided no resolution. Furthermore, after 10 p.m., there was no staff available, leaving guests without any support.

Adding to the frustration, a group of individuals played loud music until the early hours of the morning, causing disturbances and hindering sleep. However, amidst the challenges, I must acknowledge the helpfulness of some staff members, particularly the cook and Mukesh, who provided support within their limitations.

The property itself was misleading, as the rooms were shabby and not reflective of the photos provided during booking. Moreover, most rooms lacked windows and air conditioning, leading to discomfort and suffocation.

I strongly advise potential guests to exercise caution before booking a room at this hotel, as the high prices charged do not align with the poor quality and lack of amenities.
ownerResponse/text:
We apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced during your stay. We have addressed the issues arising from the behavior of other guests to ensure a more pleasant experience for our future visitors.

It's important to note that in hilly regions, there are specific timeframes allocated for maintenance, and we have diligently adhered to these schedules to minimize disruptions. We appreciate your understanding in this regard.

We look forward to the opportunity of welcoming you back to any of our properties in the near future. Your comfort and satisfaction remain our top priorities, and we are committed to making your next stay a more enjoyable one. Thank you for your patience and continued support.
placeInfo/address: Picture Palace Road Westonal Cottage, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Unethical
text:
There is a thin line between making a fair amount of profit in a business and in the name of business absolutely fooling your customers.
U cannot say i am running a hospitality business and then looting random traveeler!
Their representative from Delhi Mr. Krishna said the trarrif is 8.5k for a night.. we made full payment coz he followed up with me within one hour saying we cannot wait longer. Booked for 5day.
And when we stay at the property. We see dust, hair , durty bed spreads, dead fly, dirty room mats, the room So so dusty the me and my 1.5yr old both were allergic to the dust and sneezed the entire day .
Power cuts!
And a person whose name is Nithin who is supposed to be the manager, least interested.. absolutely uninvolved.
When i tried to get in touch with the Delhi team. They asked me to write an email..bought time..made me wait..basically wanted the 5 days to pass.They stopped responding. 
Completely disappeared!
The only thing that helpful was their cook and few staff who tried to do something and help us in their limits..the basic ethics that those staffs have that u don't see amongst people who are educated, sitting elsewhere and charging random tarrifs to people!

It's such a shame to have come across people like this .. makes us think how far is our country from being developed on these terms? Can someone really get away by charging u as much as 8.5k per night and offer u room full of dust?
Is this why the rich gets richer and the poor still goes to bed hungry in our country?
ownerResponse/text: We regret that you had such an experience with us. The team apologies that we missed your mail. As per our telephonic conversation. We have looked into the matter and resolved it. Looking forward to your next visit to any of our properties.
placeInfo/address: Picture Palace Road Westonal Cottage, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Choose wisely!!! Be clear between Hotel or Villa, this is not a hotel!!!
text:
For travellers who are deciding on Hotel booking vs a villa experience booking!! We had a family reunion and we chose seclude mussoorie  and booked entire property directly with seclude instead of any other website for which we were asked to deposit full amount one month prior to our  staying date, considering an amount of 2.2 lacs for 7 rooms, 4 days with breakfast and dinner. After payment of 1st installment which was 1.1 lacs, second installment we had to pay immediately with in 7 days, otherwise they would cancel the booking and forfeit our advance amount. So we paid the full amount. 
Stay experience, the rooms are not maintained as shown in pictures, food is home cooked but the spread of food is poor (photo) people should finalize menu while booking, no power backup, no parking consider paying rs.400/day/car as parking fees, wifi connection but very poor, staff is good, services are time limited consider max 10 pm, thereafter after 8am, staff is eager to leave by that time, so we have to wind up according to them to finish our dinner. Hope this helps!! It's your money choose wisely
placeInfo/address: Picture Palace Road Westonal Cottage, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: A homely place in a hill
text:
It’s more of a cosy hostel, well serviced and with needed amenities. The welcome is warm and services are with a smile. One has to be fit to handle the steep approach & once up there the property gives such beautiful valley views. Good, tasty food served. Next best in Mall Road which is about 10-15 minutes walk away. The beauty spot of the region is Landour and the one hour hike to reach there is amazing. Can also hire a scooter (Nagendra-9761723757) which can be delivered right at Seclude gate and then it’s your joy day driving around. 
Must say the valley view from Purple room was memorable. So are the services provided by the Seclude team headed by Mukesh. 
Can improve - in Purple room - need a cupboard with cloth hangers. Need a partition for the shower area, as the water splashes around and makes the place slippery.

title: Yes you only see green
text:
I traveled solo and this place was just perfect for me. Seegreen Lodge is a small place and has only 3 rooms which meant I wouldn’t have to interact with too many people and it also had a 5 star review for its cafe so my food cravings would be well taken care of.

The BnB was better than I had expected. The room was neat and clean and the view from the window amazing.  A special thanks to Somender Ji, the caretaker, and Gudveer ji, the cook, who made sure that I had a very comfortable stay of two nights. The best part was the long walks that I took in the surrounding forests, a total Shinrin-yoku feel. Got to see some amazing views at cloud end and near George Everest house and on the way got to chat with the locals. Some parts were quite steep and tested my lung capacity  but the satisfaction of being able to complete the trails was immense. Also got to see some exotic birds returning to their homes just before sunset. The lodge provided me with a heater in the room for the cold nights and also had hot water in the shower as well as the wash basin.

I loved the food that was served especially the veggie pasta. I would recommend this place to solo travelers, couples and small groups of friends who love nature and quietude. My best wishes to team Seegreen.
ownerResponse/text:
Shinrin yuko feel !!!!! 
WOW , This is by far 🌲 the most beautiful compliment we have ever recieved 
Yes it’s like an ecotherapy for us all the time ;  even when  we are away for a short while we crave to come home to  the nature engulfing our senses 
I’m so glad you felt the way you did 
Hope to see you the next time you are here again 
Thank you again for your kind words 😊🌲🌲🌳🌳🌳🌳🌿🌿🍀🌱🍃🍃🍂🍁

title: I would visit Mussoorie just to stay at Seegreen
text: I stayed at this place when returning back from Nag Tibba Trekking. The caretaker and cook realized that me and my friend were extremely exhausted and they lit a fire to keep us warm and also gave us hot water bad to ease our sour muscles. We chatted for hours sitting by the fire. Believe me, they are a good company. The food was great. the room was amazing. When we woke up in the morning we were simply mesmerized. we took a short stroll to the ruins and wishing well. This is the best hotel experience I've had inside India. I explored the properly and must say that I'm jealous of the 2 story cottage behind (it's only for the owner). Couples would enjoy the single log cottage.

title: One of the Best places to stay in mussorie area
text:
It was far better than our expectation. Exotic view, surroundings by beautiful mountains, cozy log hut, private verandah, amazing food and and excellent service provided . It’s quite beautifully constructed and is a great getaway not just for couples and friends but for families too. Couple trails near by to cloud end are loaded with natural beauty, deep valley views, beautiful flora on the way and quiet and serene . Our son enjoyed the trails a lot! Excellent place for thinkers and writers! Staff is very accommodating and flexible with food choices. One of the best part is the place is quite clean and hygiene is very well maintained . 30 min away from mussorie and may be an hour away from dehradun. Excellent location , easy to find and also well connected with near by cities . Camping , bird watching , star gazing can be planned. 
We would love to visit again and this time probably for for a longer duration. Log hut is priced more than regular rooms but it’s definitely worth given the facilities , comfort and delicious food provided .

text:
Seegreen lodges, the place has stunned me and made me stuck to the calmness, serenity, beauty and sumptuous food. The views at the place and around the the place are literally dramatic (not to believe ..for being so beautiful ) The hosts are very amicable and keep a check for your comfort level... The cook did not loose his patience for our demands... Staying in the Loghut was an experience, though slightly expensive but worth it.
Returning to Delhi was never this difficult as it was sucha beautiful trip for me, my hubby and little one. We are going to this place very soon again... 😍 Thank you Seegreen Team !
ownerResponse/text: Sugandhi , we love it when people like you and your family visit us . We can see how engrossed you were in taking in the natural surroundings!🌞🌸🌸☀️Waking up your little one to see the parrots 🦜 on the tree 🌲 outside the log hut . Always sitting and sipping tea ☕️ on the benches outside the restaurant . You kindness to our pahadi boys . Your fascination with the cherry blossom tree which was in full bloom . Your happiness with nature always makes us realise that it’s all worth the effort 😃 . And thank you for the kind words
placeInfo/address: Hathipaon Near George Everest Point Road, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Perfect Place for Mussorie
text: This place is really amazing stay in Mussoorie. Its about 4 KMS away from Mall road, so you are away from the hustle bustle of the Mall road, while still close enough to enjoy the town. It was a serene environment right in the middle of nature. We stayed at the their log cabin - which was perfect for our family of 3. It had a nice loft where kids could enjoy. The room is constructed with all natural material and truly gives nice vibes of being in the nature. The big glass window provided amazing views in the morning. In the morning, we walked for upto Cloud's End (about 2 Kms) and got some really cool pics. They have a good restaurant. We had lunch, dinner and breakfast there. We took Roti-sabzi, Rice-daal, Parathas, Pakoras and Chai. The food was freshly prepared and good taste. The owners happened to be there at the property, they sat down with us for friendly chat and gave us lots of tips about the area. It was an awesome stay.
ownerResponse/text:
I’m so glad you enjoyed your stay ! End of oct and
Nov first week is the perfect time to enjoy nature , it was a beautiful weather when you visited . Glad you made  most of it and thank you for you review ! 
Happy to see people enjoy our place
placeInfo/address: Hathipaon Near George Everest Point Road, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: A Peaceful Escape at Jharipani Castle
text:
Once again, I find myself drawn back to Jharipani Castle my favourite little escape tucked away in the hills. There’s something undeniably special about this place that words can scarcely capture. My room, small yet wonderfully cosy, sits quietly amidst a cascade of natural plants, giving the entire space a sense of calm and seclusion. It’s independent and peaceful, allowing one to truly disconnect from the outside world.

The charm of Jharipani Castle lies not only in its beautiful surroundings but also in the atmosphere it radiates. The air feels fresher, the mornings are quieter, and every corner seems to hum with gentle, positive energy. It’s not just a place to stay; it’s a space to breathe, to reflect, and to simply be. Whether you’re sipping tea on the balcony as mist rolls over the mountains or enjoying a walk among the greenery, every moment here feels intentional and grounding.

I often find myself recommending this place to friends and fellow travellers, and I always say the same thing: don’t just believe what I say. Go there, even if it’s only once. Let yourself experience the stillness, the warmth, and the honest beauty that Jharipani Castle offers. There’s a rare kind of peace in this place one that stays with you long after you’ve left. So, if you’re ever in need of a quiet retreat surrounded by nature, let this little gem welcome you with open arms.

title: Can't wait to be back!
text: Gorgeous location with an unmatched view of the valley at night, well maintained furnishings, and extremely pleasant and helpful staff. As a woman travelling alone I felt safe at all times! Would definitely recommend. There is also an abundance of insta worthy nooks and crannies for taking photos. As for the food, only the breakfast is provided on site. For lunch and dinner one has to head to the adjoining 19th Century Uk cafe which can get expensive. Though, that too has a gorgeous view, outdoor seating, great cocktails and a decent menu. All in all, I'm looking forward to a second visit.

title: Best stay in the 'queen of hills'
text:
Hotel Mall Palace is located on the mall road but slightly away from the main area of mall road. You can walk down the mall road or take rickshaws which charges Rs. 50 for two and Rs. 30 for one.
The rooms are very cozy and comfortable. They were very well furnished, with toiletries provided. We stayed in deluxe terrace which had two entrances. One gate opens to the terrace that has tables where you can sit, eat and relax and enjoy the view of Doon valley. The hotel since located at a height gives the best view of Doon valley. Deluxe terrace is located in the second floor and the hotel has lift making our stay comfortable. There are also rooms with private balcony located both in second and third floors. But we still preferred the terrace rooms because of the beautiful layout. Since we were 4 members, we were provided with interconnecting rooms which was really good.
The hotel staffs gave excellent service and I can surely say that of all the places I have visited, their service is something I will always remember.
The food was delicious and the service was quick.
The hotel has free wifi but only in the reception. It would be really helpful if they extend that service.
Since the hotel is located quite inside the mall road, there is no entry of commercial vehicles. Private vehicles can enter till 4:30 pm. Rickshaws are available at the beginning of mall road and also in front of the hotel to facilitate your walk up and down the mall road.

Overall we really enjoyed our stay in Mall palace and would thank them for their excellent service!

title: Nice Located Mid range Hotel for families
text:
We booked the Hotel online in 2 days advance and we got it @ 4k per room/night. We had booked 2 rooms for 3 nights in June which was a peak season. We got 1 Executive Balcony(room 1) and 1 Executive Bathtub (room 2)(that's how they distinguish in rooms). The Executive balcony room was better with wooden flooring, exclusive balcony with Mall road view and Synthetic Grass on the floor of balcony. Other Room was OK, although bigger than the first one but the balcony was actually a huge common terrace. switches for charging were lesser in 2nd room, we had to remove TV plug to charge our phones. the first room had enough charging points. 
Food was average, Parking was available which was helpful but the restricted entry timings on Mall road gave us a headache. 
Overall price charged online was lower than mentioned on the Reception due to peak season but it was not worth that much although the Manager told us that he has upgraded our rooms. Wifi was only available at reception area.

title: Nature, Peace, Quiet walking trails in the mountains, Birds, Home cooked food and warm service
text:
We got a very warm welcome from the host, Vicky and the manager, Somunder. Room was very cosy and clean. The Cafe, where in all meals are served was just below the rooms. The taste of the food was fresh at the same time delicious, was informed by the cook, Gudveer that most of the ingredients were sourced from local villages. The view of the mountains and the deep green forest from the room was spectacular. Also spotted many birds including scops owl, it is a good idea to carry a DSLR. The place is extremely quiet, pleasant - tweeting of birds is the only sound I heard in my room. The air was clean and fresh, guess I got my quota of oxygen leaving me rejuvenated.
Seegreen is a gateway to many pleasant and quiet walking trails. We went on a number of them, the one to Wishing Well and Clouds End stand out. Unfortunately could not venture out for a trek to George Everest point due to time factor, will definitely take up on my next trip.

I am surely going to be back for a longer stay in the near future, full heartedly recommend SeeGreen to all nature loving enthusiasts.

title: Love this place, calm, in arms of the nature and beautiful
text:
This place is none less than heaven, see green lodge made of wood gives the feeling you are staying with mother nature, balcony, views around it, changing the landscape within a minute will make you amaze and will make you fall in love with nature.
Take a hot cup of tea, sit and relax on beautifully designed chair for your comfort and forget everything else.
I love a few unique things about this place.
Despite competition these days to provide the best service to the customer, this place urges you to be best to your nature. You will not find everything perfect here, but living with those imperfections, will surely make you perfect caretaker of nature.
I like the note in washroom how we can save water, how we can keep things and live days over there to leave minimum or no chemical footprint to nature.
All the members here are like family, Somender was hero of this trip, he helped me with lots of stuff, from making cutome tea, providing warm water for my ill friend, to drive us from mall road in heavy rain.
I admire this guy, chance to met Vicky as well, very nice guy and could smell simplicity and nature love from this place.

I wish you have great stay here.

title: Their log hut is perfect for a quiet getaway!
text: My partner and I stayed in the log hut for 4 nights - it's perfect for a quiet, green getaway. We could see mist and mountains from our bed, and the private sitout  was perfect for journaling in the mornings, reading in the afternoons and stargazing at night. The hospitality of the staff was commendable: they were welcoming and responsive to all our requests, but non-intrusive. The food is well made, nourishing ghar ka khana. I have several dietary restrictions, and the cook Gudvir was extremely accommodating and flexible about using the ingredients I could eat in the food.  There are lovely walks and quiet spots around - the walks to George Everest's House, Cloud's End, as well as the Library Chowk in Mussoorie were largely quiet and scenic. There are several forest paths as well, though we didn't explore them as it was rainy weather. All in all, Seegreen is perfect for anyone who wants a quiet getaway within an hour's walk from Mussoorie.

title: Mesmerising and cozy
text:
This was my second visit to this quaint little place. We spend good times in our cozy room. The view of refreshing greens from the place and sudden mists of monsoon made our stay even more memorable. And of course, to make the stay comfortable, we had the ever smiling and helpful staffs of seegreen lodges. Food was good. We enjoyed every bit of our two-nights stay in this place.

If you want to spend a few days with your loved ones avoiding noises of big cities, this is definitely the place to be. The main Mussorie mall is only 4kms away. Cloud's end is also near to this place. But the best of all, in my opinion (although we couldn't be there this time due to rains) is 2 kms walk to the George Everest's house remains and the valley view from there. 

I would definitely be here if I plan to be near Mussorie in the future.

title: Amazing View!
text:
Booked through Goibibo and got the deluxe room with terrace for INR 952.The hotel is located around a km from the library bus stand, and hardly 500 m from the marketplace.
The rooms were very spacious and view from the terrace was splendid.Situated just opposite the cable car station , so was able to see the cars going up and down from my room.
The bathroom was spic and span with electric geyser .The best part was that there was no foul smell in the toilets.
Hotel staff were courteous.We informed them beforehand that we would be checking in at 8 AM and they created no major issue while checking in.
They told that "You do an early checkout by 10 AM the next day as you have done an early check in ,else pay the early check in cost".Apart from this small issue everything else was good and no complaints at all.The quality of food was also good as we had Omelet and Gobi Parantha for breakfast the day we arrived.The rates are not to expensive.
There was no Wifi range in the third floor though.
Going to recommend this place to my friends as well.

title: Stay at this hotel was very basic...pls stay away
text: we booked 4 rooms in Oct 2015 and were shocked with few things. It is on the corner of Mall road and our Tempo traveller was not allowed to pass thru that mall road (even cars are not allowed after 4 PM or so) and hence we had to stop at the gandhi chowk and hire cycle rickshaws. Ok, then another problem....the hotel did not have lift from the road level and the luggage had to be carried almost 2 floors above for the reception area and there was not much help provided by the hotel staff. The rooms were very basic for the rates they charged and there was no breakfast. I suggest that you stay away from the mall road and choose hotels on the other side, which is like 5-10 mins walk from Gandhi chowk in the opposite direction of Mall road, so that your vehicles can go up to the hotel entrance and then you can walk around in the town happily..... mall road and shopping is great, the place is very scenic and especially if you like cold climate you will enjoy.

title: Wonderful experience at beautiful Jharipani castle.
text:
The property is absolutely picturesque!! Such a dreamy view of the valley! 
Staff and service- The staff is too kind. Special mention to Hasan ji...made my stay very comfortable. From arranging travel to arranging dinner when I returned late, Hasan ji was very helpful and accommodating of individual needs. As a solo traveler, sa fety is very important to me and the staff made me feel really safe. 
Food - The rest of the staff as well....cafe staff is very friendly and the food is yum!! It's basic breakfast....but quality is good and fresh. 
Room-  opted for a standard basic room...but the room was fully equipped. The AC for keeping the room warm was very effective. Nights were peaceful and warm. 

Special note: I got caught in Mussoorie on a rainy day and I realised the benefits of staying a bit far from the city and truly in the valley. The views were to die for. And if you have good service available, it makes even a rainy day a good experience.

Highly recommended!

title: Jharipani Castle - Mussorie
text:
We booked suite room at this property which is worth the money and have nice surrounding and valley views. Service manager and staff is courteous. Lunch and Dinner is available at 19th century restaurant just outside the property which is too expensive.

Some areas where services can be improved.

1. In house dining for lunch, snacks and dinner should be available
2. Collaboration with taxi services as hotel is approx 7 Km away from Mussoorie town
3.Dental and toiletries kit such as tooth brush, moisturiser etc should be given

title: Major room for improvement
text: We stayed at the seclude for 4 nights. The concept & location is great but the upkeep of the place is so shabby. They had 4 staff, 1 manager & 3 cooks. Only two of the staff were helpful, polite & courteous. The cooks did help us with special baby food. The rooms were cleaned everyday but overall very dirty. The rugs were dirty, the cushions torn, the dusting was very shabby. The rooms & bathrooms need a major renovation. Some of the rooms have no outlet for fresh air. The outside area to sit is lovely. We got good weather. The view from the seclude is nice. The food is so so. Nothing special but average. The kitchen was not as clean as it should be. We paid a lot for our rooms. The quality & the price was a big mismatch. The management needs to take notice of the areas of improvement.

title: Beautiful location and tranquility in abundance
text:
The best part about the place is its location. It is away from the hustle bustle of the city and offers a beautiful view of the hills. If you are looking for peace and tranquility then this is the place for you. There are many beautiful walks that one can go on around the lodge. With hardly any people around and nature in all its glory, these walks are absolutely breathtaking and mesmerizing. I had gone with my family and we stayed here for two nights. All of us thoroughly enjoyed our stay. 

What also makes the stay comfortable and enjoyable is the efficient and helpful staff. All the people working at the lodge are very humble, courteous and helpful. They are not only efficient in their work but whenever I turned to them for any kind of help they were very forthcoming and responsive. So a huge thank you to them for making our stay comfortable.

The lodge has a cafe/restaurant as well. It is a relaxed,chilled out space which not only offers a range of interesting food options but also other recreational activities such as games and books for those who want to sip on their cup of favourite beverage and enjoy a good read. The cafe definitely adds to the charm of the lodge. 

The only thing that I felt required some attention was the maintenance of the place. The lodge has been done up very tastefully but the up keep of the place is lacking. For example, the floor mats in the rooms are dirty and need to be washed/changed. Also the towels in one of the rooms were very old and a little dirty. If this is looked into and improved upon then this place would actually be perfect in every sense of the term.

Overall I would say that this place is definitely worth going to. Infact I would love to visit again and maybe this time for a longer duration. Keep up the great work of running this lodge. For people like us who love in the cities it is nothing short of heaven on earth.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Thank you so much for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. 

We are thrilled to read how amazing your experience was and would like to thank you again for choosing The Seegreen Lodge.

We look forward to welcoming you back soon.

title: Majestic Palace - Memorable Stay
text:
Undoubtedly Seegreen lodges is the place to be, if you want to blend with nature. The place is nestled between Mountains. A simple room with basic amenities, just enough for a cozy stay.

Before anything, must appreciate the wonderful staff with all the right information (when asked) & who also dish out delicious food - be it Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner or Snacks (including hot sizzling chocolate brownie :-) 

The hike to George Everest Point in rain will stay fresh forever in our minds.

In the 4 days that we stayed, booked cab to visit Lal Tibba, Mesmerizing trek to Surkhanda Devi Temple at Dhanoulti, Kempty Falls, Mall Road & Camel Back road, Speed boating at Tehri Lake.

The adorable & friendly doggies is another reason we would remember this place forever :)

We are smitten - would definitely come back to stay again. 

Thumbs up to the Team and Place.

title: Perfect place to unwind
text: This place is for nature lovers who want to get lost in nature and unwind themselves from citi life, we ended up at this place with recommendation from our friend, on reaching there we just felt 'wow what a lovely place' although it is simple and basic but accommodation is clean food is very good, we are vegetarian jains and we had all our meals there for 3 nights 4 days and we did not find any problem or reason to complain. Owner, staff  all are so nice and warm that they go out of their way to make you comfortable and happy, although we were told that there is nothing much to do but we found lot of things to do especially short walks and treks around and visit to Lal Tibba Landor. Going for bird watching and trekking with their guide Sunil is experience of life.We stayed for a night in Loghut and 2 nights in room, we were very comfortable at both the places.Sitting on the deck and watching green forest around and mountains makes to distressed from everything.Having barbecue, pizza lemon ginger tea was pleasure.If you have your own vehicle you may explore nearby places as taxis are to be called and they are expensive. We found 3 nights less as we had our return booked, Truly a great experience.

title: Unplanned grad trip done right
text: We ended up at Seegreen after our grand grad trip plans to Bali/Bhutan failed to materialise. We came here with zero expectations. But the cafe, lodge and staff at Seegreen genuinely made it one of my most memorable trips so far. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us. They served us delectable food and helped organise hikes and cabs around the area. The rooms were clean, cosy and extremely comfortable. The views from the property and surrounding areas were stunning. Luckily the weather was on our side, too. And how can I forget the wonderful dogs Mowgli and Tama who kept us company throughout! All in all, we couldn’t have asked for a better grad trip. Thank you so much, Seegreen!

title: A Hidden Gem in the mountains!
text:
My friends and I stayed at the Seegreen Lodges for about 3 days. Although we were told that there isn't much to do around the area, the caretaker of the property equipped us with a lot of different activities that kept us very entertained! I want to make a special mention to Harsh and Mr. Somendar (caretaker) who took unbelievable care of every need we had. They even organise cabs for you in case you would want to go into the main town (upon request). They are very friendly and cooperative. It is also extremely safe for girls to travel. 

The guest rooms were incredibly clean. It looked extremely warm and inviting. The owners of the property have clearly paid attention to details and provided all the facilities that can ensure a comfortable stay. The best part of this property is the magnificent views. Moreover, there is a fabulous cafe right under the lodge which serves the best food.  

Honestly, its one of the best places I have stayed in the hills. Secluded from the main commotion of the town with breathtaking views. I can't wait to go back!

title: Lovely surroundings...far from the maddening crowds
text: We stayed here in the middle of summer, yet Mussoorie gave us cool climes and stunning views. Seegreen lodges is slightly far from Mall Road, but we recommend hiring a scooter since if you, like us, prefer serene and quiet spaces. I do feel the rooms were a bit run down, but the view is lovely. The caretaker boys are very sweet and helpful, but we did feel the lack of that warm hospitable touch only a host can provide. We emphatically recommend trying out the hot aloo paranthas and lovely ginger tea made by the simple pahadi woman down the road in her small yet cosy hut. It was like a scene out of Ruskin Bond's novel...sitting outside on the hillside sipping hot tea and watching the sime hill folk gossip and go about their daily business.

3-To get wi-fi you have to go to hotel reception and he or she will connect your wi-fi not allowing yourself to do it

Overall it was the worst experience I had ever faced in any of my trip to anywhere so far
Never recommend to anyone

title: The worst experience ever
text: Well readers please bear me for this essay. Going  by the reviews in tripadvisor.in where travellers praised this hotels for the scenic beauty, I made an online booking for two nights and they charged full payment in advance. When I dropped in I found the reviews of scenic beauty quite genuine. but the hotel was not unclean. It was not hygenic. And the atmosphere started giving me headache, especially the loud music outside the hotel. Within an hour when i ordered food i found the service very unimpressive and kinda bad. Therefore I immediately went out an booked rooms in Fortune Grace  Resort. When I checked out of the hotel they didnt return a single penny.I stayed in the hotel for hardly two hours. I was expecting them to to return the atleast second night's room rent. But I got nothing. The manager felt guilty and tried to convince the owner. but the owner didnt listen to him and grabbed the whole money. To my surprise, they also charged the tea tat I had in my room. Therefore, stay away from Mall Palace.

text: I visited Mussourie in Dec 2013. The hotel offers a great view of the valley and the ropeway. Although we did not like the food that much, there are several options to eat , mainly snacks, right near the ropeway. The hotel is also conveniently located. One needs to take a rickshaw from the bus stop to reach here. There is a lift in the hotel so you wont have to climb stairs. It is also near to the Mall road. The only problem is with Monkeys. Do not leave the verandah door open or windows open as the monkyys might want to pay you a visit!!

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Good services...
text: Very good Hotel according to the price we paid, we stayed there two nights and three days during last week of Jan'15.
