Rooms are also very spacious and well cleaned. Bathroom was also well cleaned and 24hrs hot water facility. TV was also working. Good behaviour of hotel staff...also in my case in early morning they specially called me to see the snowfall. Can see the the lot of monkey's and langoors on the terrance....I had enjoyed with them by giving foods, buscuits shooting photos and videos etc...Not too much far from Bus stand (Library chowk)...can walk if you don't have too much luggage. However, rikshaw is also available...If you once stay here and see the views, facility etc you will forget all disadvantage, if any... Next time i am in mussorie i will definately stay here...Totally paisa wasool...Quite satisfied and highly recommended......

title: A very decent hotel
text:
Hotel Mall Palace is a hotel in the middle of the Mall Street in Mussoorie. Location is very good, but tourist vehicles are not allowed to reach the place, so you have to walk long distance with your luggage or hire a rikshaw...One more disadvantage is that to get to the mail gate is quite hard - quite high, so if you travel with elderly people, this may be a problem, but once you reach the hotel, you will be rewarded by a great view. The hotel has got great views. At night you can see the lights of Dehradun and in the morning you can see the sunrise. Maybe noisy at weekends due to proximity to the Mall Road (loud music and shouting).
Rooms - rooms were clean, bedsheets were clean as well, towels were clean. Everything inside the hotel looks quite old, old-fashioned, but in pretty good condition. TV was working, room service was good, food was OK, tea was very tasty. No room heater in December, blankets was very warm. The hotel has got a lift :)
The only unpleasant thing was the cockcroaches in the bathroom, but India is a tropical country, so pests are everywhere...If you see them - consider them as a part of nature :))
We had rooms with balcony, so monkeys visited us several times. Be careful!!! Don't leave anything outside - they will eat or snatch.

title: Room ok, Bathroom not ok!
text:
This one is strictly for budget travellers who are determined to visit a dirty stinking hill station in the middle of nowhere. Having heard a lot about Massoorie and it being the only hill station in north west India I had not visited, I decided to stay overnight with my Father who wanted a three day break there while I completed an assignment in Dehradun for that duration. 

Driving across the Mall was a task as it was crowded and dirty. Parking at the hotel was tough as space in a small hill station hotel is limited anyway.

The lift were old fashion shutter type commensurate with the hotel age and quality.

We asked for a room with a view of the hills. This was the best part of the hotel. Lovely to see the clouds rolling up our hill and into the room through the windows! The room was strictly ok and basic. Small old TV, make do furniture and ordinary bed and linen. The balcony outside was a nice place to be.

The bathroom was old and a big put off. 

Room service was slow and food was ordinary. 

If you do visit Massoorie, do look for a better hotel to make the most of your visit.

title: Superb stay during winters
text:
We stayed for 2 nights at Seclude Mussoorie. Think of going to your grandparents' place during holidays - that's how nice the staff is to you! Very courteous, and accommodating. The food is REALLY delish! Like they'll stuff you with good food all through the day! The manager, Nitin, and his team ensure that your stay is as comfortable as possible. 

We stayed in the Wooden room, which I reckon is the bigger room. The bed is heated, and quite cozy during winters. It overlooks the valley. The seating area outside is good, and you can enjoy a bon-fire in winters (paid)

The property is quite close to the Mall Road, and one can easily walk down. You can rent scooties/bikes from the vendors near the Mall Road. Landour is around 20-odd mins from the property.

My only concern is that there's no parking on the property, and one has to park on the main road. Everything else is good.

title: Poet's Paradise
text:
So, our stay at Seclude, Mussorrie was a brief one in the month of Nov'21. And oh boy, what a fabulous experience we had, on that beautifully crafted nest placed right at the top of hill. And in case you are a creative person who loves to write/think/ponder/introspect, trust me you'll surely be on your way to create your next masterpiece. Sitting with my better half, feeding on the purest form of sunlight and sipping tea on that brick laden patio placed right in the center, all of this has been an experience I'll surely remember all my life. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. I'll cite an example to give you a flavour of their seamless hospitality.

So, I needed a scooty for some personal reason to ferry some of our luggage to Mall Road to and fro multiple times. Had a tough time to arrange the same. Mr Nitin who manages the property there, offered us help and was ready to provide his scooty to me so that I can transfer my luggage. He also lent me his helmet to us for the entire day as we planned to roam Landour on a rented scooty. These gestures which are are out of way, goes a long road, building a long lasting impression into customer's mind. Then there were two other guys : Mr Anish and Mr Dhiraj, both were kind, helpful and sweet chaps. They both offered whatever help and guidance we needed on the resort including clicking our photos, explaining the itenary for our tour, arranging scooty, bringing in fruits and impeccable room service. Dhiraj and Anish, you guys are one of the strongest assets of Seclude, intangible but yet fundamentally so important. Mr Shashi Kant, you've cooked delicious meals for us, nothing out of world, but classic Indian home made food. Do try Shahi Paneer and Dal Tadka along with fluffy phulkas. Another guy Mr Manoj also helped us in our itenary planning and gave a local guys number for car renting. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Kudos to the concept!!

Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us. We are pleased to hear that our staff made your stay pleasant. Do checkout our Facebook and Instagram pages for promos that you might be interested in. Looking forward to seeing you again soon. Take care!

Meals were delicious, with the local cuisine adding a special touch to the whole experience.

If you're looking for a peaceful retreat with personalized care and stunning landscapes, I highly recommend Jharipani castle It's the perfect place to unwind and reconnect with nature."

text: Hands down one of the best experiences I've had in Mussoorie. The rooms were very clean and the vines that surround the gate of the rooms feels.simply like our of some fantasy novel. You've got to be very crude to not like the place. I wholeheartedly would recommend the place to anyone planning to stay in jharipani.

title: Overpriced, Secluded, with Lousy Management- Not worth It
text:
Overhyped, overpriced property. Photos aren't actual. Unfortunately, got to know the reality about the "resort" from the locals only once we reached Mussorie.
Requested them to cancel our booking, after deducting the cancellation charges. As expected, it was quite rudely turned down.
Although the staff in general is polite, the
Manager cum caretaker is on the arrogant side. A simple request to "grill the sandwiches" was twice coldly & abruptly turned down by the manager first by saying, "this is the menu today", and secondly "we don't have a direct kitchen" . Although the breakfast was being served from their own restaurant, located inside their property, barely 5mtrs away.
Breakfast provided was also very mediocre.
No fruits, cornflakes etc, limited 2,3 options.
Taxi to Mall Road is minimum ₹600 one way.
Rooms although clean, aren't worth 5k+. Old construction, No fridge, AC wasn't working, small as compared to similar hotel rooms available on Mall Road, Mussoorie.
By any standards it's not a "resort". Barely 3000 sqft in total. No badminton, volleyball, tt court etc.
Visit only if you have company, or are ok with just lazing around the whole day with extremely mediocre and overpriced food.

Hotel highlights - Great view · Quiet
Rooms are Small with shared balcony. Non functioning AC. No fridge, hair dryer.
ownerResponse/text:
Mr Manav,

Thanks for the review...but would like to make few things clear....you booked our property through Make my trip and you wanted to cancel your booking at the last moment since you were already staying in some other hotel and getting a cheaper hotel in Mall road and coming to us you would have to hire a taxi which again you had to pay... whereas in Make my trip voucher it's clearly mentioned NO CANCELLATION AT THE LAST MOMENT... then you called us saying that your plans are cancelled for coming to Mussoorie ...our manager told you the same thing that as your booking is through Make My trip we can't cancel at the last moment... then you had booked a normal room but when you came you wanted FREE UPGRADION of the room which again was not possible.,so please note if you demand unreasonable things and are not fulfilled you should not put false allegations...as all our rooms are with AC well functioning..yes normal basic room doesn't have a MINI Bar... regarding breakfast all our guests are fully satisfied but again you wanted complimentary chicken grilled sandwich etc...we never mentioned badminton or volleyball courts in our place....so next time please make sure what you plan to book within your budget...

title: The best of Mussoorie at Seegreen
text: Seegreen lodges was the highlight of our visit to Mussoorie. Located at the serene location of hathipoan, Seegreen is the perfect location for some beautiful hikes(George Everest and clouds end). The rooms are super comfy and overlooks the mountain. The Seegreen cafe located at the ground floor of the lodge serves up some of the best food. From hand tossed pizzas to their honey lemon ginger tea, everything is prepared by love and it shows up in the taste. The caretakers at the lodge are super nice and will help you with local tips to travel around the location. The lodge is located off the hustle bustle of Mall Road and landour. Seegreen let’s you be in nature and is the perfect location to refresh your senses. Finally, the owners of the lodge and cafe  go out of their way to welcome you and make your stay perfect. A lovely couple who loves the mountains and doing their bit to sustain the environment and develop the livelihoods of the local people. Do not miss the chance to experience Seegreen.

title: Amidst Nature - A serene place
text:
We visited this place in the end of March with my 22 months old son and stayed in the loghut for 4 days and had an awesome experience. My son has become a huge fan of this place and I had to literally drag him out of the place as the vacation came to an end. All FIVE points to the service, property and cleanliness in the loghut. The staff was so well trained that they themselves asked me if i need something specially made for my child and trust me they gave me exactly as we needed. 
The freshness of the vegetables and pulses gave me a sense of the pure air we are in (people call it organic) and also it came to a surprise when at such a hill station you get a woodfired pizza; delicious pasta and sizzling brownie. One of the must haves is Kheer and Mutton (Red meat for non-vegetarians). 
Also if you are a traveler or want to spend some me time they have a lovely collection of books and a few games (e.g. Jhenga) which one can be with. Also a fantastic place for meditation outside the loghut. 
Lastly if you are pet lovers they have two dogs (Mowgli and Tama) who take care of the property so well that you feel secure because they are so well trained. Loghut being at a height and every night walking up to the loghut with a child felt a little scary but these pets would guide you up and make your stay even more safer. 
A BIG THANK YOU to the owners for letting us explore such a clam and quiet place. 
See you again soon.

title: A world of its own
text:
If you are looking to cherish uninterrupted mountain views, unadulterated fresh air and the sweet chirpings of birds, you are at the right place. Seegreens lodge is a world in itself that offers amazing views of both valley mountains covered in fir and deodar and the snow-peaked Himalayas. We stayed at the Log hut for 3 nights and it has been one of my best experiences till date. 
It is situated in a nice location that is away from the Mall Madness of Mussoorie but only a 15min drive from the city centre. With a discreet location, it allows you to immerse yourself in nature and forget all worries. The cafe with its cozy atmosphere offers multi-cuisine dishes and amazing hot beverages. The staff is very friendly and always up for some nice chat. But the best part was Moogli and Tama, the two mountain dogs. The Log hut is cozy with warm interiors and the fireplace adds that extra charm. All I had to do was take my book, find the perfect nook and give myself to the surroundings. It is a must-visit if you are in Mussoorie.

title: Great place in the mountains
text:
If you want a quiet, relaxing mountain holiday where you sit and enjoy the view in the mornings while drinking hot masala chai, go for long mountain / forest walks, come back to hot tasty food and enjoy the stars at night, then this is the place.

This is far enough from Mussoorie that it doesn't feel like a crazy, crowded Indian hill station yet close enough that you can drive to Mussoorie town proper in 10-15 minutes.

1. Great staff, they go out of their way to provide you with all the amenities. Specially want to mention Subhender and Ramesh.
2. Good fresh food. Especially try the vegetables they've grown in their own vegetable gardens.
3. The log hut is very well maintained and has a quiet patio where you can sit and enjoy the mornings and the evenings.
4. Amazing mountain walks starting from the property (to cloud end, to George Everest house, to bird sanctuary)
5. Lovely dogs - Tama and Mowgli :)

Tip:
Go for the log hut over the rooms - better views during the day as you get to sit in a quiet, small patio.

title: A new favourite!
text: This was one of our very best holidays. It's not often that you find a B&B that ticks all the boxes: Great -- location, lodgings, food, and hospitality. See Green is a beautiful, tranquil place removed from the bustle of Mussoorie town. We stayed in a log cabin, steps away, yet out of view of their cafe and rooms. We felt like Thoreau, camping at Walden. From the bed, we had a grand view of the pine forest and hills, perfectly framed by a large window. Our kids claimed the loft, settling in comfortably with their books and belongings on the comfortable futon upstairs. Although outwardly rustic, the cabin was fitted with creature comforts, including a water kettle and geyser. The bathroom was not unlike that in any small hotel. Mornings, we sat on the small patio and read or spotted birds. Nights we gazed at clear skies and spotted constellations. We went on long walks through the forest, one of which led us to the house of George Everest, Surveyor General of India. After hours of walking, we looked forward to returning to a hot meal at See Green, which has a modest but delicious menu of Indian and continental food. The proprietors, Vicky and Ameesha, who visit on and off, welcome you like family. They make sure you want for nothing. We had a lovely time talking to them about the history of the area and noted their recommendations on places to visit. You don't have to bring books along; their library is small but varied, from old issues of National Geographic, Duckbill books and Western classics for kids, David Baldacci...you get the drift. Can't wait to come back.

title: A getaway amidst nature
text:
We all city dwellers come to a point in time where you want to be amidst nature yet away from the humdrum while on a holiday.. Our search for the above steered us to Seegreen lodges. The drive from Jolly grant airport wasn't the best considering the number of bends in the road and an infant who pretty much threw up all the way, but this homestay tucked away from mussoorie yet in mussoorie made up for it all.. 

We pretty much didn't venture into mussoorie except for visiting cambride book store as the nature trails around the homestay were sufficient to keep us busy for 4 days..

Don't expect luxury at the homestay. This isn't even the right place to expect that.. Simple rustic and cosy comfortable rooms are what makes Seegreen lodges themselves.. 

We had dinner on all days at the homestay and the food prepared is fresh and delicious.. We even bought a pahadi sabzi from the market which the chef gladly made for us.. I absolutely loved the green chutney and even tried asking the chef about how he makes his version... Totally did not succeed in my mission!

Loved this homestay and hoping to revisit it again for sure..

title: A perfect hideway
text:
This time my hideout was Seegreen Lodges , A hidden hut surrounded by misty mountains and pines. Tastefully done rooms, and intelligent choice to have no WiFi here. Life.Smile.Bliss one in one.

Tucked in a quiet corner in Hathipaon is this quaint cafe filled with much warmth. A sign board on the way mentioned " free tea tasting" which caught my attention and I had to hop inside. After happily having filled with my tummy with Adrak chai and. Chicken pizza I happen to exchange glance with a lady and she happened to be none other than the owner. The menu sees some nicely done pizza, few dishes from Indian menu and drinks.

Run by Sanjeev and his wife Amisha this happy couple takes their break from City life and prefer to sip their hot cuppa here. Once you chat with them you get to know where the cafe gets its warmth from.. sharing some moments of laughter I came out on a all Happy note

title: Nice place but not good service
text:
I am writing this review hoping it reaches the owner. I stayed at this property for 2 nights from 23rd and 24th Oct, 2018. Of course I chose this place looking at the excellent reviews across most of the websites. However, below is what I feel about this place:

Location: Superb; quite and pristine
Food: Great (the daal and mix veg was awesome)
Cottage: This is where I stayed in. The moment I entered the cottage, I could sniff the lack of cleanliness. The place was covered in dust and there was a strange smell emanating from the place. The inside design of the cottage is cozy and cute but the attention to cleanliness clearly showed the indifference of the staff in maintaining the property. We were welcomed by a giant spider too the moment we opened the bathroom cupboard. The curtains were all stained. You don't expect these when you are paying 10K for 2 nights in a hill station. We didn't use the towel since we were not sure whether they were clean too. So 0 marks for the 'inside of cottage'

Staff: Its strange to see so many good reviews about them but frankly speaking, I doubt those reviews. The staff might be good as they were from the hills but in my stay over the 2 days, I never saw them smiling. They were never rude but that sense of welcoming was never there. Maybe, they lack the training to make people feel happy about coming and staying there.  They were also careless about certain things like they never cleaned our rooms. Once we had asked them to do but they never bothered to check once if the rooms need to be cleaned. On the first night, a bottle of ketchup fell and broke near the seating area outside the cottage; it was never cleaned even when we were checking out. The complimentary omelette that was served in the morning breakfast was without any onions and tomato.When checked, the guy said that what I was asking was masala omelette and its not a part of the package. Seriously???? So in all, the lack of training was clearly visible.Had the owner been there, I would have asked for a refund. Frankly 10 K for this place doesn't seem to be worth. This place can be made so much nicer since its located at such a superb place. So, not a great experience 

Thanks
Navin
9873647150
ownerResponse/text:
Hi Navin,
Apologies from the team of Seegreen Lodges.

We never expected a guest to face such inconveniences. Your feedback is extremely valuable to us, and your point is duly noted. We promise to look after the matter with seriousness. Hopefully we can greet you in a much better fashion the next time you visit us.

Thanks a lot for the support. We look forward to cater you better in the future.

Regards,
Seegreen Lodges Team

text: We did not book a hotel and had decided to check three hotels, based on location, comfort and price.  This was the last one on our list - and met all of our considerations.  Price was exceptionally good as we were there just prior to their busy season, which was to start around middle of May 2014.  We got two rooms on the third floor which had a private balcony.  Nice view of the valley during the day, and good view of lights from the town below - Dehradun.  Cars on Mall road are limited to private vehicles, and that too at certain times only.  We had to take rickshaw to get our luggage over to the hotel.  We enjoyed hotel meals as well as in this small town. Cup of tea - only a phone call away and is served in your room within minutes.  Hot water / cleanliness / nice view / friendly and helpful staff / - overall this was a nice small holiday.  Thanks to hotel staff, and all the help. title: Excellent cosy stay!
text:
For an honest review, I have many pros and very few cons. Here goes:
Pros:
- Unbelievable Scenic views. The sunset view from this property is to die for
- Excellent service. They are extremely accommodating and go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and happy. We reached late the first evening, and they managed to keep our food ready and warm, even past the time they serve meals as per their policies. We really appreciated this gesture!
- Vibrant rooms. The rooms are very colorful (we stayed at the purple rain), and there was plenty of sunlight and beautiful views even from our room. The room was extremely spacious too with tons of cubby holes to stock your luggage and knick knacks
- Delicious food. I never felt like I was miles away from home, or from the best tasting dishes back in my hometown. Their food tastes so good, I was instantly in love. As part of their amazing service, they also made sure to make our food non spicy as we'd asked for.

Cons:
- Steep uphill walking climb to get to the property. Expect a steep climb for a bit where you will be bound to take a break to catch your breath midway, from where the cars are parked, to reach up to the property. That said, their staff is extremely helpful in carrying your luggage upstairs with them so you don't need to chug that along.
- Limited parking. The parking here is on the street, but is safe as we were told. However we did get a parking ticket during the peak traffic. However despite this, the hotel manager extended to cover for the ticket cost and got us a better parking spot. As before, excellent service.
ownerResponse/text:
Thankyou so much  for your lovely feedback. We appreciate that you took out some time  to share your experience.  We are glad that you had a comfortable stay. We look forward to host you again in the near future.
 Best Wishes from Team Seclude.

title: Seegreen, a destination in itself!
text:
I was lucky to come across this listing and after looking at the rooms discovered they also have a wodden cottage for rent set a little away from the cafe and the rooms. 
The location of Seegreen lodge makes it a destination in itself away from the hustle and bustle of Mussorrie town. George Everest point, wishing well, clouds end and other brilliant bird watching trails are all within walking distance. The food served at the cafe is tasty and reminds you of home cooking. Do try the baked veg and pizzas.
I can't recommend this place enough to people looking for a quiet getaway in the hills. Vicky and Amisha (owners) and their entire staff are the most welcoming and friendly.
I will surely be back 🙂

title: Five Memorable Days
text:
There’s magic in this place. The mountains pour forth their misty tentacles, wrapping you in heady swirls. Soon you begin to forget that there is a worry-laden world down below. What with the many beautiful treks, the calls of birds, and the stunning views, this is a nature lover’s dream come true. The comfortable room, the charming café, and the polite staff together take care of your temporal wants, leaving you free to indulge your soul. If I didn’t live so far away in Chennai, I would be going there ever so often, just to revel in the peace and silence.
PS: Kama the dog is absolutely adorable…such soulful eyes.

title: Stay amidst nature's lap
text: Seegreen lodge was recommended by my colleague when I was planning short trip to Mussoorie with my wife. The moment I steped out of my car I realized that I have taken a right decision by following my friend's advice. The place is strategically located just 10 to 15 minutes before Mussoorie away from the maddening crowd. We both are nature lover and this place was aptly surrounded by lush green mountains and clouds. The view was great from the  balcony and we had very calm, peaceful and pleasant stay. This place is also blessed with indigenous super cool cafe with a notification board that "you are entering a stress free zone". The ambience of cafe was really a stress buster in its true sense. The cafe is really nice and blessed with wonderful staff who will serve you mouth watering dishes as per your wishes with a pleasant smile.  Complimentary breakfast was served there. Honey Lemon Ginger tea was my favourite. A must place to stay who enjoys nature away from city hustle bustle.

title: Memorable Stay
text:
My friend and I stayed at SeeGreen Lodges for 5 days. It's surrounded by hills and offers a great view. It is much quieter here compared to the town. Early mornings are especially beautiful. We (both women) felt safe going on treks to Cloud End, Wishing Well and Sir George Everest view points. We even walked all the way to the Mall Road in Mussoorie.

The room interior is tastefully done and the size is good enough for 2 people. The room was cleaned on alternate days but It would have been nice if the room was cleaned everyday during our stay.

The ambience of the cafe and the food served is great. On request the chef even prepared and packed Kulith parathas for us for our trek. We loved the parathas and my friend even bought Kulith daal from there.

Dog lovers would love the two dogs at the lodge - Tamba and Mougli. Five days felt too short. I totally recommend this lodge to anyone going to Mussoorie. And a special thanks to the staff at the lodge. They were friendly, polite and always ready to help.

There staff asks us where to keep tea, we asked him u tell as there was no side table even to keep tea ordered by us. Electric kettle provided but no place to plug it for power supply, I guess it's for show piece only.

title: Pathetic
text:
Friends after reading about my horrible experience in this hotel m sure u will avoid it for ur best..
We had booked the room some 2 months in advance mentioning time n again that we r a family of 3 n my mum had recently had a surgery so the convenience shud b gud.they kept on saying "YES SIR...dont wry it wil b absolutely comfortable."
jst a wk b4 our trip they suddenly changed dre words saying since u'll reach after 6pm...dis area has restricted access to vehicles n thus u'll have to tk a ricksaw to reach the hotel..mentioning the fact that if we cancel the booking at this stage,we wl hardly have any refunds.
I asked Mr.Sanjay that is it restricted all the time or is dre ny time limits coz we nid a cab for the sight seeing,shopping etc
He promptly replied no Mam the permit is only restricted aftr 5 or 6 pm so u wont face ny problem..We believed them....n that was foolish on our part to trust his words..

On reaching the hotel which was not at all a comfortable journey from mall road with temp dropping to 12 -13 degrees...n sitting in the ricksaw for some 30 mins...we found dre staff...who were cordial enuf.,giving us various options for the room.
we chose a valley facing room instd of the terrace room as the latter lacked privacy for families...giving a common terrace..

had our dinner n rested for the nite.the 1st shock was to know that the geyser dsnt function properly in all the rooms.u r lucky if u get the hot water supply properly..else its ur luck to suffer in that cold weather as they have an instant geyser connection..u'll get hot water after some one n a half hrs...so that was a great thing to know...
From midnight we suffered of food poisoning!!! Gosh ...!! but thankfully we carried medicine with us.so got alright  in the morning..

it was cold enuf for us to order tea n some light snacks...n as soon as we had that..we agn started having vomiting..we understood that its best to avoid the food dre as the hospital was nowhr nearby..

The next day we hoped to get a cab from them so that the sight seeing cud b done...on calling up the reception a lady responded quite rudely that we dont have  any cab facility nor can we arrange any vehicle for ur sight seeing.u nid to tk a ricksaw, (paying 40/- each person each time)go to mall road n from dre hire a cab urself.we r not responsible for ur sight seeing!!!!!!!!!!!! Else u shud hv booked a cab from dehradun n came here .keep the car in our parking for as long as u stay n then move around freely by ur personal cab.
 wasnt that pathetic to know for those who had repeatedly asked before coming regarding the transportation to know that they cared least for the sight seeing or our comfort..is it the way they shud behave with tourists..???when they knew that we were coming dre from far off ..atlst they cud hv told us clearly on getting the cab from dehradun...how can ppl who r going there for the 1st time wud know that a so called PALACE dsnt even have a cab facility of dre own..!!!.We clearly understood that it was completely our fault to book with them ..

They messed up our stay,were highly uncooperative n provided the fact that restaurants r a little far off they charge hefty for the food...n that too a food which will surely make u fall sick..

I will never recommend anyone to go for this hotel Mall Palace if she/he wants to have a comfortable n pleasurable trip to mussoorie..

title: An excellent experience- mall palace
text:
excellent interiors.. brilliant view and awesome location and very good service.. overall the stay in Mall palace exceeded my expectations.. Food is best avoided(based on numerous teas and one meal I ordered. Also there are many brilliant options available outside).
The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is right in the middle of mall road and hence very convenient for the people who want to just take leisure walk on mall road.
The staff was very polite and helpful. They even arranged for a cab, were flexible in checkout time and also happily agreed to keep our luggage till we left mussoorie.. The room service was very good except the food which can be avoided(Do try cafe Kalsang nearby for excellent chinese/tibetian cusine). Also there are good road side places which offer very good Rajma/rice..a local speciality.
View is amazing. If you take Delux terrace option you can use the big terrace which is riht under the ropeway and also you can see a very good view of Deharadun while sipping tea from your terrace.
Overall an excellent experince. I plan to go to to mussoorie again and if I do, hotel Mall Palace would be my choice. no doubt.

title: Good hotel, good location, excellent view, though quite 'un'peaceful
text:
Its a good hotel, with an excellent view of the doon valley. The rooms are comfortable and clean. We stayed in deluxe suite- balcony and would suggest the same to all travelers, as the balconies open onto a breathtaking view of the doon valley as well as provide you that personal space. The room service is very good, the housekeeping even better. Errands are done within minutes and the waiters and attendees take delight in helping the guests. The reception is okay, not very helpful though. The one big drawback of the hotel we experienced was that of crowd control, meantersay that the guests who occupied the terrace rooms very very loud mouthed and uttered expletives whilst talking amongst themselves as well as drank liquor right there on the terrace (in broad daylight needless to say then, in the night too). It was embarrassing and very very disturbing. And the worse part was that upon asking them thrice and further requesting the reception staff and subsequently the hotel manager, nothing was done to ask those guests to maintain the decorum. On the contrary, a blame was shot back that its the festive season so the expletives are common, upon which i wonder, how many of us utter abuses upon ourselves during festivals. Hence, due to this incapability of the hotel administrative staff to deal with situations like this (which i call crowd control), i would suggest families to avoid this hotel.
Summarising, the hotel is good, the view from the hotel (esp. balcony rooms) is breath-taking, the room service and housekeeping is excellent and the location very good, however the ambience is that of chaos and hence not peaceful at all..

title: Centrally located hotel with nice view of Doon Valley
text:
I along with my 2 friends planned a weekend trip to Mussourie from Noida. Since I have never driven in hilly areas so felt safe to park my car at Dehradun railway station, paid 70 RS for 24 hours parking and board a bus bound to mussourie which charged us 41 RS per head. You can get bus to mussourie from dehradun railway station itself. 
We reached there in around 1 hour and headed straight to Hotel Mall Palace which had been just like my family hotel for last 31 years. When I was on way to mussourie from dehradun My father told me over phone that he and my mother stayed at this centrally located hotel facing the ropeway and Doon valley in 1982 when they were in mussourie on their honeymoon. That time it was a newly built hotel which had tariff of 32 RS. He always make a point to stay in this hotel whenever he is in mussourie. Seeing this hotel, I also recalled our several summer vacations to mussourie in my younger days, I had been to mussourie thrice before but all the trips were almost 10 years back.
Now coming on to hotel, you can choose from room ranging from deluxe @ 2000 rs, deluxe terrace@ 3200, deluxe balcony @3400, luxury with bathtub@ 3600, 3 bed suite@ 4000 to 4 bed suite@ 4400. These are the rates for May June and July which is peak season, otherwise there is flat discount of 50%. This hotel is very close to camels back road and Appu Ghar. You can easily get a paddle rickshaw in front of hotel to visit nearby places.
The 4 bedded suite in which we stayed was a quite nice with private terrace from which one can have pleasant view of Doon Valley which in night looks like cluster of twinkling stars. All rooms are equipped with LCD (but who cares when on a trip to hill station, we didn't saw any thing except news for few minutes), room and toilet were clean and room service was good. Prefer rooms on higher floors as they have balcony and private terrace for view of valley. 
Don't forget to hit the YES button if you found this review helpful !!

title: Feels like I am living in Heaven
text:
I generally don't give reviews, but this place deserves one. It helps me to found what i am actually.
 
I visit Mussoorie last week with my husband and stayed at Seegreen Logdes. The place was awesome with wooden based ambiance. It's just 4 kms from Mall Road and sits in nature arms. The view from inside and specially outside the room can filled your heart with peace and happiness. The cool air and fantastic view of mountains with birds voice will make to you to forget all your worries, anger and other problems. 

Other thing which refresh your mind was the cafe located downstairs only. It was decorated beautifully and in artistic manner. If you are book lovers, then It have a small library too inside cafe . The sitting area inside and outside the cafe was excellent with sofas , bean bags and chairs. The food and beverages was delicious, specially the Pizza and Lemon Honey Ginger Tea.

You can also ask the staff to play the music of your choice and enjoy having dinner or lunch with your partner. The nature will add more love to it.

You can enjoy trekking too and visit George Everest and Wishing Well located nearby Lodge and famous destination in Mussoorie.

You can easily reach to Seegreen Lodge with cab, even the manager there will arrange cab too if you wan't. Siddharth who manages cafe and logde is a great person and always have a smile on his face :) . He takes care of your every need and guide you well. The other staff members were also very nice.

I love to stay at Seegreen again and recommends the same to others.

title: Home away from home in nature's lap
text: Didn't know that such a place exist within Mussoorie. The location is superb, at the junction of cloud's end, wishing well, George everest point and mall road. The rooms pro ode views that makes one feel right in the middle of  hills and trees, to add to it the rooms have a nice pine wood interior that makes the room feel very cosy. Sit outs add to this experience. The common Cafe serves finger licking food with a very warm and courteous staff. The chef prepared tandoori chicken on demand and it was nothing like what I ever had back in Gurgaon. Siddharth, who manages the cafe and lodge, adds a very vibrant and youthful energy through his choice of music and his warm smile. The cafe has a nice collection of books and games to keep visitors engaged. Last, but no the least, we had the good fortune of bumping into the lodge's owners, Sanjeev and Ameesha, who felt like family/friends we were meeting in a home away from home. Very memorable stay - truly loved it!!!

title: Love Nature and hiking... Best place in Mussoorie
text:
Seegreen Lodge is an excellent getaway and an ideal place for nature enthusiasts. One can take long leisurely walks around the place or can hike to george everest peak or cloudend place. This place is away from the Mussoorie town and hence is peaceful and quite throughout the day. The rooms are just right for a small family and intelligently decorated. A lot of place outside the rooms so that you and your friends can sit in the evening and can have fun.

Another thing that stands out about Seegreen Lodge is the food. They prepare some lip-smacking, delicious meals. The staff is pleasant and helpful. The dining area is comfortable and nicely decorated. I guess they are fan of chumbak... Owl decoration everywhere. A north indian will really love the food they prepare. They got some nice shakes.

Siddharth (manager) who is also quite enthusiastic and is a lover of nature, took all the guests on short nature walks near by to all the places. He makes our stay worth too. He looked after our needs and was there all the time.

We had immense fun staying at Seegreen Lodge. Definitely worth a second visit.
I would suggest rather than staying in mussoorie... Stay in Seegreen.

text:
Seegreen Lodge is an excellent getaway and an ideal place for nature enthusiasts. One can take long leisurely walks around the place or can choose to retire himself or herself at the lodge and listen to the bird songs. This place is away from the Mussoorie town and hence is peaceful and quite throughout the day. The rooms are just right for a small family and intelligently decorated. Another thing that stands out about Seegreen Lodge is the food. They prepare some lip-smacking, delicious meals. The Honey-Ginger Lemon tea is a must have. The staff is pleasant and helpful. The dining area is comfortable and nicely decorated. 

Being close to the nature, I would recommend an in-house naturalist, who can take the guests on short nature walks and help them spot different birds that flock this place.

We had immense fun staying at Seegreen Lodge. Definitely worth a second visit.

title: Going to Mussoorie and love nature? Look no further!
text:
I lived at Seegreen during my trip to Mussoorie in January this year. I loved the place! Staying in Seegreen allows you to be in nature, away from the maddening crowds, yet just 4KM from the town. It is also perfectly located to take a morning trail to Benog Wildlife Sanctuary and is on the way to George Everest Point - a popular destination.

The rooms are clean and spacious, yet have a cozy feel to them. The bathrooms are absolutely clean as well. All of my requests were taken care of with a smile by the staff.

Food was never an issue as the cafe serves delicious food. It's where I ended up having all but one of my meals. Doesn't get much better than starting your day with aloo paratha and coffee on a cold winter morning while birding right from the cafe.

I would highly recommend Seegreen for anyone visiting Mussoorie who wants some peace and quiet without burning a hole in their pocket!

title: Great Hotel at a good price
text:
It was our first visit to Mussorie, after reaching dehradun, we didn't take a bus which would have been very cheap but bit uncomfortable but we took a taxi instead which charges Rs100/person on sharing and Rs500 for taxi if you want to hire. The Taxi dropped us at the starting of mall Road and then it was a tiring journey for about 1km to the hotel(will recommend you to ask the taxi guy to drop you to garhwal Mandal taxi stand as from there you have cycle rickshaws to take you to the hotel and would be helpful to old people or even people tired of sick of hill journey). Hotel is clean decent with balcony facing the Hills and ropeway(right across the road) but luckily there wasn't much noise because of that. Room service food is OK at best, so it would be better if you try restaurants outside on mall road. Breakfast was OK. Room has a quilt to keep you warm from outside chill. In Off season you can get greatttt discounts i got a rate of 1300/night in the beginning of November. 

One advise, keep your doors and windows closed as there are a few monkeys nearby who can come to your balcony if they see somebody. Overall good place to stay as it is the centre of Mall road opposite the ropeway to Gunhill.

title: Nice Stay and Wonderful Experience
text:
After analyzing lots of hotel thru Tripadvisor finally I decided to choose Mall Palace Hotel based on reviews posted here. I found these reviews very helpful and after my visit I am posting my review as below with pics:

I stayed in Mall Palace Hotel with my wife, opposite to Ropeway on Mall Road, Near Jhulaghar for 4 nights in Super Deluxe room on 4th Floor (Top Floor). It costs us Rs 7500 thru MakeMytrip.com + Rs 500 for pre-checkin. I must say that this is the hotel one should prefer while visiting mussoorie for a pleasant and hassle-free stay.

1. Mall Palace Hotel is on mall road providing wonderful view of Dun/Doon Valley.
2. Ropeway (near Jhulaghar, Mall Road) is just in front of this hotel.
3. Kulri Market (having Mussoorie Sweet Shop, Mangloo's Kulcha & Momos Shop, 5D Cineblast & Scary House, branded showrooms, restaurant and gift shops etc.) is at walking distance of around 5 minutes. 
4. Main Points like Nirulas, Dominos, CCD, State Bank, Rikshaw Stand, Jwahar Aquarium are at walking distance of maximum 2 minutes only.
5. Library Market(Gandhi Chowk) is at walking distance of 5 minutes only.

Two extreme ends of mall road are:
1. Picture Palace/Kulri End have main market, taxi stand and bus stand. 
2. Library Market(Gandhi Chowk) End also have a small market, taxi stand and bus stand.

Ropeway (Jhulaghar) is almost in middle of these two ends. Best part of mall road is between Ropeway and Picture Palace/Kulri end having all kind of shops, eating points, branded showrooms and banks etc.

I asked hotel to arrange a pick-up for me from Dehradun Station at 8:00AM to hotel which costs me Rs 800 (Taxi hired from Dehradun taxi stand in Rs 610 will enter at mall road if you will pay entry fee of Rs 100 and Rs 100 for local charge only, else it will drop you at Picture Palace Taxi Stand). When I reached station I got my cab in 5 min and reached hotel around 9:30AM while my check-in time was 12:00PM. When I asked for pre-checkin I was charged for quarter day. Hotel staff took luggage from cab to hotel reception and from there to my room. I found room well managed and clean equipped with LCD TV with cable connection and a Refrigerator. 

Hot and cold water was never a problem as hotel was having excellent power backup facility. Even cleanliness and hygiene was never a matter of concern as washrooms & rooms dry n wet cleaning was a routine job along-with daily changing of bedsheets and towels.

Main places we visited are:
1. Jwahar Aquarium : Just a minute or two walk towards library end from ropeway having two most precious fishes among many (Rs 20/person, Rs 20 extra for photography or Rs 40 extra for videography).
2. 5D Cineblast and Scary House : At kulri end, must watch 10 minute 5D movie to have an amazing experience (Rs 150/person) and scary house (Rs 70/person)
3. Company Garden : At a distance of 5.5Km, can be reached only by Rickshaw (Rs 60/person single side)
4. Viewpoint Visit on top of hill by Ropeway (Rs 75/person both side ticket, time no bar).
5. Kempty Fall & Bodh Mandir : At a distance of around 15Km can be reached by hiring taxi  (Rs 820 from kempty fall taxi stand and Rs 1120 from picture palace taxi stand). Don't know about visit by private buses, somebody told Rs225 per seat in bus. Its better to share a taxi with other family/couple if you can.

On the day of check-out I asked hotel to arrange a coolie to carry luggage till picture palace taxi stand and they did in 5 minutes, collie charged Rs 70. Hotel staff never asked for tip and was very courteous. I booked a taxi to dehradun railway station which costs me Rs 760 (Rs 610 to dehradun railway station from picture palace taxi stand, Rs 100 for Mussoorie Lake sight-seeing for 1 hour on the way and Rs 50 for Shiv Mandir  visit for 15 minutes on the way).

Note:
1. Hotel food was not upto the expectation.
2. Cable TV goes as it seems that cable operator had no power backup, must be replaced by DishTV.
3. Dominos pizza was very costly as compared to prices in Delhi and base was different, tasteless pizza :(
4. Complete mall road can be visited by walking without any problem.
5. Watching 5D movie was amazing experience.
6. Prefer to have food outside based upon your taste and choice, will cost less, all kind of eating points available on mall road.

I hope this review will help others.

title: It’s not a place, it’s an experience
text:
Summarizing this place in a paragraph is not going to do enough justice to it but I’m still going to try. So we got here at noon, after an hour an half long drive from Dehradun. It’s in a place called Hatipaon in Mussorie. Nestled in the heart of the mountains, Seagreen Lodge has a direct view of The George Everest peak and tourist attractions like Cloud End and Mall road are few Kms away. You can take a cab/bike or just trek to these places like we did. Would strongly recommend you to trek as we got great pictures and a wonderful experience out of it. About the Seagreen Lodge itself, it’s owned by this wonderful man Vicky, who is extremely warm and helpful and him with helpers Somender and cook Gudvir make you feel so at home. Special shootout to the cook though, at the end of the trip, you would want to take him home. The food was insanely awesome. From the coffee and sandwiches, the parathas to the local pahari dinner of sarso da saag and makke ki roti, everything was out of this world! The rooms are cozy and clean, but we hardly spent any time in there as we couldn’t get enough of the breathtaking view from the lobby and balcony. The cafe below is a pretty quaint place with an interesting collection of books and indoor games. It also has an outside seating, where we had most of our meals. 
The best thing about this place is the pristine silence that lets you enjoy and take in the soulfulness of the mountains as you cut off from your mundane city hustle. We had booked for just 1 night but ended up extending for another day and we’re glad we did. 
Just find your sweet spot either at the balcony, lobby, cafe or the veranda and read, write, sketch away your time while soaking in the beauty of everting this place has to offer.
ownerResponse/text: hey vidhisha - you described the place so well...the place is meant for nature lovers like you. look forward to hosting you and ravi again soon..cheers
placeInfo/address: Hathipaon Near George Everest Point Road, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Ideal place to stay near Mussoorie for nature-lovers.
text:
I have been wanting a vacation for a long time to take a break from daily schedule. Being from Mumbai, I was looking for a place away from the city hustle & bustle in Mussoorie. Luckily, I stumbled upon this property on Air BnB.

Situated about 4 km away from Library Chowk end of Mussoorie, this property is surrounded by lush green pine tree mountains. It is an ideal place to stay for people who are looking for a peaceful and serene accommodation.

The owners Vicky and his son Arjun were really great hosts. They made sure all my needs were taken care of during my stay there.

The rooms are simple, clean and cozy with all the necessary amenities one would need during the stay (Yes, including 24-hour hot water shower). The walls are thin though, so make sure you are considerate enough to not make loud noises and ruin the experience of your fellow guests.

The cafe downstairs offers some really lip-smacking food cooked by their cook Gudvir. Ginger Lemon Honey drink is something you would not wanna miss. They offer a variety of options on their menu for us to choose from. I would personally recommend Alu Paratha, Chocolate Waffles, Tandoori Chicken, Chicken Masala and Dal Khichdi Tadka. The cafe also offers various books and magazines to read and games for kids to play. You can also connect your iPhone/iPod to their music system via Bluetooth and play music you like.

The room tariffs and the menu price are very pocket-friendly and are definitely worth every penny.

I would strongly recommend this property to everyone who wants to experience nature while in Mussoorie. Definitely coming back here soon.

title: Peace and Serenity
text:
Hathipaon  is a place nestled between the green pine tree mountains surrounding the very famous hill station of Massuri, Uttarkhand-( India ). The area is a remote zone and promises to give peace and serenity and a break from the hustle bustle of city life. The place is not so popular amongst the holiday seekers who to prefer visit the parent town of Massuri but if you wish to seek to spend time with mother nature's bounties, this is the place to hit. SEEGREEN lodges are byfar the only decent property offering stay -

The property is accessible by good  roads till the doorstep , and location is simply awesome. Staying is comfort at its best given the remote location and hostile climate during winters - Waking up to the chirping of the birds with no snooze options promises a wonderful start to the day and the all day long café makes sure your taste buds get their dues .  There are couple of interesting places around the property ( Bird sanctuary and view points which open up to the valley ), which may require a bit of walking, but for a lazy day off - the property sounds just perfect to sit, chill and keep stress levels at bay .  I would wish to recommend the place STRICTLY FOR THOSE WHO CAN DIGEST THE MAGICAL SILENCE - AND ENJOY THE SOUNDS OF NATURE . The staff did really good to keep our stay as memorable as it could be . 

Food served is good, and the collection of books in the café are quite interesting. The café also boasts nice music, table games for the kids and ambiance quite classical.
ownerResponse/text: Hello kunal. It was indeed fun spending time with you and entire family in cafe over Kenya games and on long walks with you. I look forward to welcoming other family members from Mumbai soon :)
placeInfo/address: Hathipaon Near George Everest Point Road, Mussoorie 248179 India

title: Peace.. for what i was looking for
text: It was last minute plan on diwali evening where we have no idea where we are going to head. All of a sudden hathipaon seegree lodge poped out in mind. Though i have heard alot from friends like cleanliness, food and the location where this is located. so without giving any second thot everything was booked in a blink of eye. title: A special resort !
text:
A short drive from Clouds end, Mussoorie, is this rather quaint charming looking cottage, which we may have missed had not hunger pangs got the better of us. A pleasant discovery awaited us the moment we entered the cafe. An old world ambience, that you fall in love with instantly. Light coloured wooden furniture, an eclectic collection of books and magazines, table games, a speaker for some music and old posters of rock music gods like Jimi Hendrix, Eagles create the right ambience.

The ultimate was the food. The personal touch of the owners was evident even from the menu which has been delightfully written. Each item lovingly and freshly prepared with vegetables grown organically on the farm located on the premises was the clincher. The subzi-roti, noodles and soup were outstanding as was the service. The place also offers lodging facilities in three rooms on the upper floor which were neat and well furnished. Ideally located near a forest and a bird sanctuary, the tranquility makes it suitable for nature lovers and those in search of solitude.

If healthy and delicious food, in a cottage in sylvan settings is your weakness, you can't go wrong. This is the place for you.
ownerResponse/text:
hello rima,

title: Hidden Gem among clouds
text:
I came to know about this heaven while surfing for a getaway from the maddening city crowd.

This place had rave reviews from the travellers, hence went for a shot after checking through their website(which is self explanatory).

I must admit , i was a bit circumspect after the way the owners had warned us not to expect a resort.However as soon as the day i reached the property till the day I left every hour they kept on throwing surprises and  exceeding my expectations.

The Gems which made my trip sparkle are:-

1. The Property:-  
                            It is a beautifully located  single storey lodge , nestled among trees with breathtaking views. There are 3 rooms all being spacious and well kept.One thing which grabbed my attention was that its all wood, hence you can hear your steps:).
The corner room has splendid views on all sides along with a balcony. 
                            Ground floor is the cafe cum restaurant. I appreciate and applaud owners choices and intentions while creating such a cool place. The cafe has something for all, Books (Lots of them,all genre), board games , magazines. You have an option to play your song by connecting your cell through Bluetooth.
                             All in all value for money.

2. Food:-
                             I have been to many a hotels where we had no option but to eat outside as either the food is too expensive or its bad. 
                             However , this place is an exception, seldom I come across a place where the whole menu is their speciality:). This is one such place.
                             Aloo Paratha, masala chai, Honey chilli potato, Khichdi, Pahadi Kadhi, Barbecue, Pasta..... All were to die for , however Indian cuisine is one not to be missed 

3. Caretakers:-
                          There are 3 people who go out of the way to make your holiday a memorable one. Somendra,Gunveer and Soham.

                          

Looking forward to my nest trip at this place:):)
ownerResponse/text:
wow rohit,
you described my place so well. M really happy that we made a memorable holiday for you!
Gudvir is a local cook and trained by my wife - i am so happy that travellers have admired his home cooked food time and again.
look froward to your next visit - weather is just getting nippy and we know that winter is just round the corner...bukharis are being cleaned as we would need them to create the required warmth.
cheers
vicky

title: Worst & Best
text:
Well Where do I start from. The place in pictures looks beautiful  and artistic and we booked because of that. We got a pretty decent deal and with these corona times we wanted our own space.

We had booked 5 rooms out of the 7. The place is decent but a bit of hike . Parking is on the main road where ur cars are not safe . 

Hygiene  - the place is dirty to the core and not at all maintained . Pictures show a very different picture of the place . It’s smelly , there is damp, lights and gyser and shower are not working . There is water on the floor as it was raining . 

Food - the food is wonderful . Menu is short but that is understandable. We had most of our meals there as we liked what they cooked . 

Accessibility- it’s pretty close to the Mall Road so that is a nice part but is a steep climb to reach the place . 

Staff - The in house staff is great . People
Sitting in delhi are pretty helpful but it’s very confusing at times who you talking to . 

Communication- they have these numbers there and it’s irritating as it’s so bloody difficult to reach them. 

All in all good place and good view but bad hygiene and bad maintenance.

title: For a quiet, walking holiday
text:
I spent three days at Seegreen in April this year and was charmed by the experience.  Nice, homely food, long walks towards the bird sanctuary, wonderfully pleasant weather and, most importantly, peace! (though on a Sat, the traffic by the side road to Everest point was a touch irritating).  
The accommodation is warm and comfortable, though the bathrooms are small and needed some attention (which Vicky, the owner, mentioned they'd do).  If you are travelling to Mussorie and would like to stay away from the town and the tourism zone (that includes Landour), this is the place.
When I do visit Mussorie again, Seegreen will be my preferred stay option.

title: Great peaceful stay
text:
Location is little far from Mall road but this is the beauty of the place. Very peaceful surrounded with scenic beauty. The place is equipped with all basic necessities and one should not expect a hotel or resort kind of services as this is not either. Food was very delicious and staff was also good. I have only 2 suggestions, rest all was perfect- 
1. If guests have arrived at 10PM and extremely tired, asking for tea, please oblige with smile even if you are not a hotel or resort. Tea is a very basic ask and not luxury. When we reached after 14 hours of tiring road journey, we asked for tea and apparently the staff was not very happy with our request and reacted in a disappointing note. Tea served was not good either. though it is a very small thing but why to give a single chance to guests to complain :)                                                                                           2. Water for basic daily work is a necessity and first day we had to wait for half an hour for water supply to start smoothly so that we can start with bathing and all. Staff informed us about issues (air in pipeline). This should be rectified.
ownerResponse/text:
hello arti

Your point is noted for the tea. have taken corrective steps already. as you know - we have only 3 pahari boys who are sufficient for the 3 rooms + boutique cafe. However, on the day of your arrival, there was a party by a local politician and that tired out our team...regrets for the same.

Thanks for regarding us with 4 starts. you taking time out for a review means a lot to us and we look forward to seeing you again soon at the lodge

vicky - gudvir and somender

title: Quaint little place nestled amidst silence and a sea of green
text:
I would recommend this place to anyone who's looking to stay away from the hubbub of the main stream city and the Mall Road - like we were! For the noise, there is Delhi. But for the idleness of the quite mountains blanketed with green and sporadically spotted with bell-necked hill cows grazing lazily, there is Hathipaon. Seegreen is 10 steps away from a stretch where these heavenly meadows unfurl. But before that, be prepared to wake up to clouds in your balcony!

The rooms are on the smaller side but perfect for two people. The cafe and the rooms are done up tastefully, the food is very fresh and they take about 30-45 minutes to prepare whatever you want to eat. Net net we loved the cottage, the cafe, the vibe, the location and the food. Thumbs up! Keep up the good work!
ownerResponse/text: loved your review - thank you sooo much for taking time out to reward us with stars!!

title: FABULOUS Stay ... !!!
text:
I was bit nervous before booking this kind of stay as I was not sure of location and service but after reaching the destination I found myself between the the one of best location I have ever been too in India. Seegreen lodge is very easy to reach as it is located at corner of  the main road leading to Kemty fall,, During the day it becomes little noisy due to honking on road but Morning and evening are very pleasant with bird singing. The food at the cafe is very tasty and freshly cooked. SOMENDRA and his team (Care taker) are very friendly and very attentive. This place is only for those people who wants relax and enjoy the nature, 

Pros:
1) Very good location
2) Staff is very friendly
3) Rooms are very well laid out though little congested for triple occupancy.
4) Food at cafe is very tasty and fresh

Cons:
1) Need to improve on House keeping 
2) Room we stayed in had very bad foul smell but Ok with exhaust fan in bathroom, I think that is due to plumbing mistek. 
3) cleaning of bathroom

Room Tips:
1) They have three rooms, choose room in either corner as it has extra window with good view.

I would defiantly recommend this place for the people who wants to relax and rejuvenate themselves with nature.

title: Warm and friendly feel..
text: This homestay is very conveniently located and has a warm homely vibe to it. For lovers of nature trails staying here is 'the' option to consider as one can simply walk out from the place and walk right into the heart of the forests. Food here is quite good and the caretakers are a friendly lot. The best deal would be to be able to travel in a group such that one can book all three rooms to allow   more privacy and quietness.

title: Homely stay.
text:
It is located in Hathipaon, just a few minutes from Mall Road. The stay is homely and the food is good in the cafe. 

It's quiet in the morning but the road becomes busy as the day progresses, resulting in traffic noise. 

Also it is located in a village, so expect frequent power cuts. The cable TV in the room was not working as it required top up. 

Hope the management rectifies this. 

The chef and the caretakers are very helpful.

title: Perfect hideout in Mussoorie
text:
If you are looking to experience the pleasures of a hill-station - tranquility, bird songs, mountains and forests - without being bothered by urban crowds, then this is a perfect hideout. 
Sights of trees, mountains, avifauna, and a few villagers going about their chores is all you get over here.
The rooms are well furnished and have all the basic amenities. The restaurant (SeeGreen Cafe), tastefully decorated, serves a wide variety of delectable fare. The staff is courteous and prompt and attended to every trivial need of ours.
There are quite a few trails nearby for the bird-watcher / nature walker, which add to the attractiveness of the property. Mall Road, too, ain't far away - a 10 minute drive takes you straight to Library Chowk.
The real pleasure is in sitting on the veranda, after a long walk, sipping ginger tea, and reading a Ruskin Bond book while birds play a sweet symphony in the background.

title: Perfect stay for nature lovers looking for a weekend getaway
text: Absolutely loved staying at Seegreen lodges. The lodge had a lovely view of the mountains and sipping tea early morning in the balcony was a great start to our days at Seegreen. Also, one can hike to both George Everest point and the bird sanctuary, both accessible on foot from the lodge. Both the hikes were totally worth it and when we came back tired at the end of the day, we were welcomed with great food (The yellow dal, yum!), hospitality of both the bhaiyas, board games and a small library which made our stay just perfect.

title: beautiful stay in the lap of the Mountains!!
text: Imagine a stay where cloud floating in the lap of mountains. Isn't this line is super exciting? Well, I booked this hotel for 9 family members just by seeing pics and reviews online.  These were the words of my parents "This place is just like heaven, like you can actually touch clouds" :). I was glad and felt i made the right choice by booking this. Fantastic home stay with beautiful cafe. Owner Vicky and care taker both were really helpful. I must say if you want to enjoy real mussorie, this stay with peace and away from the crowd is perfect for any and everyone. my family members had private vehicle so there were no issues of transportation for them.

title: Will stay again & forever
text:
We had family long weekend here.
- extra ordinary location ..literally u see green..no crowd of ppl,no noise,no crowd of hotel buildings
- professional well trained caretaker..they will only talk when u ask something.Took care of our little demands due to small kid of 1.5yr
- Cafe is unique with plenty of books,cosy corners,books, toys,music..i think this is a passion of owners ..USP of this place

- home cooked tasty food ,innovative menu ..thanks there is no puri subji ,chhole bhature like typical northy items
- we ate chicker curry & almost all ..its just super tasty
- clean rooms with veranda with lot of seating place to have tea & bf while looking at mountains,valleys
- 4 km away from main square..still easily accessible
- they gifted a gulabjamun,  ruskin bonds's book & pen..nice gesture  by owners
- just book & experience it..cant review it further

title: Quiet gateway in the hills
text:
We were keen to do a day trek around Mussoorie and were looking for a quiet base for the night. Research for hotels and resorts did not yield the kind of properties we were looking for. However, we hit the jackpot when we tweaked our search term to homestay! Seegreen lodges is perfect if you are looking for a quiet hideaway, homely food and lovely trek paths. Not to mention some gorgeous avian friends who entertain you for free! And then there is Tama, the adorable puppy. 

The staff knows how to smile and is super friendly. The views from the first floor is soothing for stressed urban souls. The lodge's proximity to George Everest Point, Benog Hill, Mussoorie town makes it perfect for people who love to walk. Especially, if you could get up a bit early, the roads are all yours. 

Kudos to the owners and staff for keeping the place basic yet tantalizingly appealing for nature lovers!
